story:
Unequally Yoked, Written & Directed by 

Lynette J. Blackwell.  

Who doesn't love the theater?  A place where you can go to get away from the world.  Where laughter can be heard, and the smiles and tears of the audience can be witnessed.  I have been a fan, from musicals to dramas, and have found myself immersed in many adventures.

The day that I called myself a Playwright opened my eyes to another world.  But the moment that my play Unequally Yoked graced the stage in 2012... That changed my life forever.  Since its inception, I have been blessed to produce Unequally Yoked in the NY Tri-State area, and it has been enjoyed by audiences of different ethnicities, genders and ages.  We have an opportunity to take Unequally Yoked on the road, to Dothan Alabama, the peanut capital of the world.  

We are to arrive in Dothan on April 15th at the Historical Opera House, and at this time we are slated for 2 shows (Prayerfully more will be added)...

April 16th @ 3pm & 8pm.

Synopsis 

What has Franklin Regis gotten into? In  Unequally Yoked!, life is proving to be quite a challenge for him as the newly appointed pastor of the Church of Genesis to Revelations. Saddled with an unruly flock, cuckolded by a dazzling new wife with unholy aspirations and faced with saving a family legacy that is quickly unraveling, Pastor Regis finds himself stuck between a rock and a hard place.

What People Are Saying About Unequally Yoked

Pat Cousar-Amsterdam News NYC

If the dress rehearsal for Lynette Blackwell’s spiritual stage play “Unequally Yoked” is indicative of the full ensemble, then she is truly on the road to becoming an excellent playwright and director. 

Her debut with a live audience will be Friday, March 27. Staged at the National Black Theater, the show will run four days for a total of eight shows. The cast is exciting and musically talented, and the musical arrangement will uplift the audience. The spiritual stage play is produced by Harlem’s own Rob Base, who brought us hits such as “Get on the Dance Floor” and the all-time favorite, “It Takes Two,” as well as the historic “Joy and Pain.”

Blackwell’s play is a tale of relationship woes through betrayal, forgiveness and hope. It is inspirational and speaks to various life dynamics. Blackwell told the AmNews her inspiration for writing the play came out of her own personal struggles of being in a marriage that was unequally yoked. “I was in church service one day and it came to me so clear—‘Unequally Yoked’,” she said. “I wrote it down in a book and tucked it away. I didn't know what exactly God was telling me. I kept writing, and then I realized that God was speaking to me. I wrote when God told me and when he didn’t, I didn’t.”

Base came to the set and spoke with the AmNews. He expressed excitement about the play. “I’ve been looking for something different to do for a long time,” he said. “When I saw it for the first time, I said to myself let me jump in and get behind this play.” 

Talented and Gifted! Had the pleasure of checking out "Unequally Yolked" Written and Directed by Lynette Blackwell and it was amazing. April May as "Lola" was hilarious. She may have enjoyed that part a bit too much though. Lol. Go check it out folks.. You won't regret it!  I. Grigg 

An inspiring production about the power of forgiveness.  The unseen hope and love found only through Christ.  A play that doesn’t weary the eyes, but inspires our heart.  D. Collington 

A big shout out to the cast from the play Unequally Yoked, especially Lynette Blackwell  I am glad that I got to see all your hard work pay off!!!  Can’t wait ti see what is next. D. Thompson 

What can I say… I am so very proud of you and what God is doing in your life.  The play was awesome!!!  S. Bueford-Wilder 

We had a VERY good time at the show.  Michael’s favorite is Ice Pick.  Thank you Lynette Blackwell for a nice Sunday evening.  T. Ingram 

This was a fantastic play, there wasn’t a dull moment.  It was like an emotional roller coaster it made you wanna laugh, tear up, and think about what would happen next.  It gives you a little old and new school, capturing the interest of all generations, and at the same time sending a message and an eye opener to leadership and the saints of God.  Lynette is truly gifted!  I Mclean 

I had the opportunity to attend this play on last evening.  It was awesome.  The actors and actresses were superb.  The play gives a full analogy of what Pastor groupies do.  it’s scenes drew the audience to interact with the actors during the theatrical performance.  More than a timely drama about leadership tension, but a spiritually potent story that portrays people looking toward a better life.  it creeped in on me slowly, by degrees.  I was hardly aware of it until that moment when i couldn’t even stand to be around the subtitled devices of satan, and i started grumbling because “Lola was off to he next victim.  Lynette Blackwell; you have proven yourself to be a playwright!  E Piccola Foster-Lewis

It was a spiritual, humorous, heartfelt and just flat out reality play. It was easy to relate to the characters because in life we all know someone just like the characters presented. I chuckled, praise God, and laughed extremely hard while watching this play. It's a must go see! You will walk out at the end of the show still chuckling shaking your head!  R. Eddy 

Where has Unequally Yoked Been?

National Black Theater (Harlem, NY) 8 shows, March/April 2015

Roy Arias Theater (New York, NY) 5 Shows, March 2014

Dempsey Theater (Harlem, NY) 2 Shows, Jan/April 2013

Also appeared in Long island, NY, Brooklyn NY and Elizabeth NJ. 2012/2013

Why We Need Your Help

Moving this production to another state is so needed, because entertainment is very important, especially in todays world.  We need your help to bring forth a production that is not just entertaining, but also visually pleasing  Below please find the breakdown for Unequally Yoked.  

Unequally Yoked Team Includes...

Cast of 10 and a crew of 5.  

Venue-$3200, Cast salaries-$4000, Flights from NYC to Dothan Alabama-$6,150 15 Passenger Van Rental-$400, Hotel rooms-$600, Advertisement-$2000. Set/Props-$1500

Total=$17,850

As you can see, we are only asking for a 1/3 of the expense, because we have the other portion.  

Your help is Key to the continued success of Unequally Yoked, so it is most important, that if you are inspired to please share this project with your friends.
I thank you in advance from the bottom of my heart... See you on the stage!!!

Base came to the set and spoke with the AmNews. He expressed excitement about the play. “I’ve been looking for something different to do for a long time,” he said. “When I saw it for the first time, I said to myself let me jump in and get behind this play.” 
Talented and Gifted! Had the pleasure of checking out "Unequally Yolked" Written and Directed by Lynette Blackwell and it was amazing. April May as "Lola" was hilarious. She may have enjoyed that part a bit too much though. Lol. Go check it out folks.. You won't regret it!  I. Grigg 
An inspiring production about the power of forgiveness.  The unseen hope and love found only through Christ.  A play that doesn’t weary the eyes, but inspires our heart.  D. Collington 
A big shout out to the cast from the play Unequally Yoked, especially Lynette Blackwell  I am glad that I got to see all your hard work pay off!!!  Can’t wait ti see what is next. D. Thompson 
What can I say… I am so very proud of you and what God is doing in your life.  The play was awesome!!!  S. Bueford-Wilder 
We had a VERY good time at the show.  Michael’s favorite is Ice Pick.  Thank you Lynette Blackwell for a nice Sunday evening.  T. Ingram 
This was a fantastic play, there wasn’t a dull moment.  It was like an emotional roller coaster it made you wanna laugh, tear up, and think about what would happen next.  It gives you a little old and new school, capturing the interest of all generations, and at the same time sending a message and an eye opener to leadership and the saints of God.  Lynette is truly gifted!  I Mclean 
I had the opportunity to attend this play on last evening.  It was awesome.  The actors and actresses were superb.  The play gives a full analogy of what Pastor groupies do.  it’s scenes drew the audience to interact with the actors during the theatrical performance.  More than a timely drama about leadership tension, but a spiritually potent story that portrays people looking toward a better life.  it creeped in on me slowly, by degrees.  I was hardly aware of it until that moment when i couldn’t even stand to be around the subtitled devices of satan, and i started grumbling because “Lola was off to he next victim.  Lynette Blackwell; you have proven yourself to be a playwright!  E Piccola Foster-Lewis
It was a spiritual, humorous, heartfelt and just flat out reality play. It was easy to relate to the characters because in life we all know someone just like the characters presented. I chuckled, praise God, and laughed extremely hard while watching this play. It's a must go see! You will walk out at the end of the show still chuckling shaking your head!  R. Eddy 
Where has Unequally Yoked Been?
National Black Theater (Harlem, NY) 8 shows, March/April 2015
Roy Arias Theater (New York, NY) 5 Shows, March 2014
Dempsey Theater (Harlem, NY) 2 Shows, Jan/April 2013
Also appeared in Long island, NY, Brooklyn NY and Elizabeth NJ. 2012/2013

Why We Need Your Help
Moving this production to another state is so needed, because entertainment is very important, especially in todays world.  We need your help to bring forth a production that is not just entertaining, but also visually pleasing  Below please find the breakdown for Unequally Yoked.  
Unequally Yoked Team Includes...
Cast of 10 and a crew of 5.  
Venue-$3200, Cast salaries-$4000, Flights from NYC to Dothan Alabama-$6,150 15 Passenger Van Rental-$400, Hotel rooms-$600, Advertisement-$2000. Set/Props-$1500
Total=$17,850
As you can see, we are only asking for a 1/3 of the expense, because we have the other portion.  

Your help is Key to the continued success of Unequally Yoked, so it is most important, that if you are inspired to please share this project with your friends.
I thank you in advance from the bottom of my heart... See you on the stage!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello , I am Renii Charleston, a 44-year old seasoned actress and an inspiring writer, I have written an amazing stage play entitled "Dare to Dream". This is a MUST SEE production.

"Dare to Dream" was written and designed to give hope, empower, and to spread the message that DREAMS DO COME TRUE! This premiere event will challenge individuals socially and culturally, inspiring all to dream outside of the box. A catalyst for positive thinking, Dare to Dream possesses the power to alter decisions, ignite growth, and ultimately change lives.

We are looking for individuals, businesses, and organizations to help us make this event truly special for our community. Your sponsorship and/or contributions will help us to put on this production on a major platform.  It will also afford you the opportunity to target potential customers that may not be captured in your current marketing campaigns. It will also spotlight your community involvement and provide you with strong visibility in the communities of your consumers, which can increase brand loyalty. It is our goal to make our association with you a positive one, in promoting your participation and publicly expressing our appreciation. This sponsorship includes Dare to Dream agreeing to exclusively sell and promote your product and/or services (excluding all competitors) during your sponsorship.


 

 

The Impact

The importance of investing in people is a model that even our national leaders can't deny. Because someone invested in me, I've had the honor of working with prestigious writers, producers, ad directors in Memphis, TN. My body of work consist of being cast in 2 movies, one featured M.A.D.E. sitcom, a host of plays and a one woman monologue. In 2015, I attended the David E. Talbert Actors workshop in Atlanta, GA. Thanks to the Talbert experience, I am better equipped for the journey. Your support of my efforts to inspire others to not only Dare to Dream, but to pursue their dreams, helps to make for a better city


Life is but a dream....... DARE TO DREAM

story:
Who we are

Since its inception in late 2015, The Bipeds Dance Company, under the direction of dancer/choreographer Stacy Wolfson and banjo player/ songwriter Curtis Eller, has thrived in the pursuit of genuine collaboration. Performers of various disciplines are brought together to seek out the elusive flashes of inspiration that flare up where their disparate techniques intersect.
Wolfson and Eller have devised a unique compositional approach that seamlessly combines movement, music and lyrics to create a peculiar and compelling hybrid of dance and song. They cast the finished pieces with dancers and musicians possessing the curiosity, technical proficiency and requisite disdain for boundaries to delve into one another's mediums. Musicians become dancers, dancers become singers, and unhinged howls of wild abandon are briefly and inevitably reconciled with harmony and grace.
The Bipeds make their theatrical debut in June 2016 with the evening- length, "Never Enough Better Nothing" in conjunction with Eller's rock & roll band The American Circus on June 3-4, 2016.

 

What we need

Your generous donations will help us pay for:

the performers, rehearsal space, performance space, building a dance floor, lighting designer, photographer/videographer, and if we are lucky-ourselves!

story:
(English translation downword! ) :-)

CHI SIAMO

La prima italiana di "Romeo&Juliet Post Scriptum" di Annika Nyman è andata in scena il 20 Maggio 2015 al Teatro dell'Orologio di Roma con Giovanni Anzaldo e Selene Gandini e la mia regia, ed è stata una bellissima esperienza.

In particolare per me, il lavoro di traduzione fatto con Annika dallo svedese all'inglese e poi all'italiano è stato una sfida molto interessante e stimolante. Annika è poi venuta a Roma a vedere il nostro lavoro e per fortuna le è piaciuto molto.

Adesso abbiamo l'opportunità di portare lo spettacolo, al Festival Fringe di Edimburgo il prossimo Agosto; abbiamo uno degli spazi migliori, il Teatro 1 al theSpace on the Mile (http://www.thespaceuk.com/edinburgh/thespaces-o...), ma per impegni precedenti Giovanni e Selene non potranno esserci e passeranno il testimone a una nuova coppia di altrettanto validi attori madrelingua inglese, Sara Lazzaro e Francesco Petruzzelli.

Ora dobbiamo rimettere in prova lo spettacolo e debuttare al meglio ad Edimburgo!

Ecco perché chiediamo il vostro aiuto :-)

grazie a tutti,

Georgia 


ROMEO E GIULIETTA Post Scriptum- note di regia

Non è facile scrivere due righe sul perché ci si appassiona a un progetto.

Già la passione ha in sé poco di ragionato e molto di istintivo, quando poi si tratta di Shakespeare per me è quasi impossibile trovare una spiegazione razionale.

E' come un eterno, inspiegabile, ineluttabile, immutato amore.

Un po' come quello di Romeo e Giulietta, appunto.

E gli star-crossed lovers per eccellenza, destinati ad "amarsi a morte" nei secoli dei secoli in qualunque forma d'arte conosciuta, hanno sempre avuto la mia attenzione speciale.

Impossibile non appassionarmi al testo (e alla testa!) di Annika Nyman, giovane autrice venuta dal freddo, che li fa sopravvivere alle intenzioni di Shakespeare pur non tradendolo mai nei contenuti.

Tutti prima o poi ci siamo domandati che cosa accadrebbe se Romeo e Giulietta non morissero.

Ma se così fosse, sarebbero vivi? O sarebbero dei sopravvissuti..?

                                                                                                      Georgia Lepore

DI COSA ABBIAMO BISOGNO

- Sala prove:                    $ 1130     (£    800)

- Tassa Iscrizione:         $   558     (£    394)

- Affitto Teatro:               $ 2627    (£  1860)

- Viaggio:                           $ 1400     (£ 1000)

- Alloggio:                          $ 2825     (£ 2000)

- Vitto:                                 $ 707        (£   500)

- Assicurazione:               $ 339       (£    240)

- Fondo Emergenze:       $ 707        (£   500)

TOTAL:                     $  10.293       ( £ 7.295)

Come potete vedere il TOTALE supera il nostro "goal", quindi abbiamo bisogno di tutto l'aiuto possibile.

Quindi, per favore, se vi va donate anche se abbiamo già raggiunto il nostro obiettivo.

Abbiamo 40 giorni per raggiungere il nostro obiettivo di $ 6.500.

Contribuendo alla nostra campagna riceverete un "omaggio" che testimonierà la nostra gratitudine. Questa è una campagna "Flessibile", vuol dire che riceviamo i fondi raccolti in 30 giorni anche se non raggiungiamo il nostro obiettivo.

Saremo grati per ogni donazione, piccola o grande che sia; "l'unione fa la forza", quindi anche 1 solo dollaro sarà d'aiuto!

Se superiamo il nostro obiettivo è una grande opportunità per rendere il nostro spettacolo migliore :-)


WHO WE ARE

"R&J PS" by Annika Nyman had its italian premiere on May 20, 2015 at Teatro dell'Orologio in Rome, starring Giovanni Anzaldo e Selene Gandini and directed by me.

Being part of this project was a great experience, especially for me as a director, and a fun challenge having adapted the original script from its English translation (from Swedish) into Italian. Annika came to see the show in Rome and loved our production.

We now have a chance to take the show to Edinburgh Fringe Theatre Festival this coming summer, we've provisionally secured a great venue, The Space on The Mile, Theatre 1 (http://www.thespaceuk.com/edinburgh/thespaces-o...), but due to previous engagements the original cast, Giovanni and Selene, will not be able to participate and they will pass the baton to the equally dynamic english speaking duo Sara Lazzaro and Francesco Petruzzelli.

Now we have to rehearse and hopefully make the Edinburgh premiere the best that we can!

That's why we ask for your help :-)

thank you all

Georgia


ROMEO & JULIET Post Scriptum- Director's Note

It's not easy to write a few lines about why one becomes passionate about a project.

Passion itself knows little reason and its moved by instinct, and when it's about Shakespeare, it's very nearly impossible for me to be rational about it. It's an atavistic love, unexplainable, undeniable, unchanging.

It's a bit like that between Romeo and Juliet, indeed.

And I've always had a special interest in the star-crossed lovers, destined to love each other to death through the centuries and through all art forms.

How could I not get passionate about Annika Nyman's play (and mind!). The young author who comes from a cold country, makes them survive Shakespeare's intended ending, never betraying his writing.

We've all asked ourselves, at one time or other, what would happen if Romeo and Juliet didn't die.

But if they did, would they be alive or would they be survivors?

                                                                                            Georgia Lepore


WHAT WE NEED

- Rehearsal Space:     $ 1130         (£  800)

 - Application Fee:      $ 558          (£  395)

- Venue:                         $ 2627       (£ 1860)

- Travel:                          $ 1400       (£ 1000)

- Accomodation:         $ 2825       (£ 2000)

-Food:                             $   707         (£   500)

- Insurance:                   $  339         (£   240)

- Contingency:              $ 707          (£   500)

  

TOTAL:                  $  10.293       ( £ 7.295)

As you can see our TOTAL exceeds our goal, so we need all the help we can get.

So please, feel free to donate even if we have reached our goal.

We have 40 days to reach our goal of $6500

By pledging money to our project you will receive one of our rewards. This is a "Flexible Funding" campaign, meaning we keep all funds, even if we do not meet our goal. 

We appreciate any donations, no matter how small or large may be; "there is strenght in numbers", so any dollar helps! 

If we go over our goal, it only helps to make the show better :-)

story:
Who am I?

My name is Marcelina. I'm 19. I can't remember exactly when my dance journey began. At the age of 8 I joined a local dance group (TESS) in Tarnowskie Góry. At the beginning I treated dance just as fun. With time it evolved into my passion. Visits to a ballet room became my daily routine. After some time hard work started to pay off and bring me not only satisfaction but also trophies.


What is so special about dancing?

Human body is capable of showing a lot emotions without using any words. Dancing is an amazing art of movement. It enables me to keep harmony in everyday life and express positive and negative emotional states. Actually, I can not imagine my life without dancing. It would be empty.



What is the goal of this fundraiser?

Earlier this month I attended workshops with instructors from one of the best European dance academies in Munchen - Iwanson International School of Contemporary Dance. They noticed me and proposed an education at Iwanson without getting auditioned. It is an amazing opportunity to become a proffesional dancer which I always wanted to be. Unfortunately, living expances and school fees are too high for me to meet. My parents can't fully cover expected expenses. My mother is unemployed due to health problems. That's why I need your help.


Monthly expences: 

300 euro - dormitory
400 euro - living expances
550 euro - school fees
= 1250 euro
A full year of studying in Munich costs 15000 euro.




Every cent counts. Make it possible!
You can also help me by using the sharing tools available on this page to spread a word about my fundraiser .
Thank you very much!

This campaign is ended, but I created another one. Here you can find it: 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/butterfly-wings-part-2/x/11610432#/story


If You have any questions feel free to contact me  : 

marcelina.liebner96@gmail.com 


w języku polskim : 


Kim jestem?

Nazywam się Marcelina. Mam 19 lat. Nie jestem w stanie określić, kiedy rozpoczęła się moja przygoda związana z  tańcem. W wieku 8 lat dołączyłam do grupy tańca TESS w moim mieście - Tarnowskich Górach. Z początku miałam bardzo luźny stosunek do zajęć. Z czasem taniec stał się moją pasją. Przebywanie na sali baletowej stało się  codziennością. Ciężka praca zaczęła się opłacać i dawała mi nie tylko satysfakcję, ale także liczne trofea.


Dlaczego taniec jest dla mnie wyjątkowy?

Ludzkie ciało jest w stanie pokazać mnóstwo emocji nie używając słów. Taniec jest niesamowitą sztuką ruchu. Umożliwia mi zachowanie harmonii w codziennym życiu oraz pomaga wyrazić pozytywne i negatywne stany emocjonalne. Właściwie nie wyobrażam sobie mojego życia bez tańca. Byłoby puste.


Jaki jest cel tej kampanii? 

Na początku tego miesiąca brałam udział w warsztatach, które były prowadzone przez instruktorów uczących w jednej z najlepszych szkół tańca w Europie - Iwanson International School of Contemporary Dance w Monachium. Prowadzący zauważyli mnie i zaproponowali, abym rozpoczęła edukację bez przechodzenia audycji. To niesamowita szansa, aby stać się profesjonalną tancerką, którą zawsze chciałam być. Niestety koszty utrzymania i czesne są zbyt wysokie. Rodzice nie są w stanie pokryć tych wydatków. Moja mama jest bezrobotna z powodów zdrowotnych. Dlatego proszę Was o pomoc!


Miesięczne wydatki:

300 euro - akademik

400 euro - dodatkowe koszty np.jedzenie

550 euro - czesne

= 1250 euro

Aby przez rok studiować w Monachium jest mi potrzebne 15000 euro.


Każdy grosz się liczy. Wszystko jest możliwe!

Możecie mi także pomoc udostępniając za pomocą przycisku dostępnego na tej stronie .

Dziękuję bardzo!


Jeśli macie jakieś pytania śmiało piszcie : 

marcelina.liebner96@gmail.com
story_txt:
Who am I?
My name is Marcelina. I'm 19. I can't remember exactly when my dance journey began. At the age of 8 I joined a local dance group (TESS) in Tarnowskie Góry. At the beginning I treated dance just as fun. With time it evolved into my passion. Visits to a ballet room became my daily routine. After some time hard work started to pay off and bring me not only satisfaction but also trophies.




What is so special about dancing?Human body is capable of showing a lot emotions without using any words. Dancing is an amazing art of movement. It enables me to keep harmony in everyday life and express positive and negative emotional states. Actually, I can not imagine my life without dancing. It would be empty.



What is the goal of this fundraiser?Earlier this month I attended workshops with instructors from one of the best European dance academies in Munchen - Iwanson International School of Contemporary Dance. They noticed me and proposed an education at Iwanson without getting auditioned. It is an amazing opportunity to become a proffesional dancer which I always wanted to be. Unfortunately, living expances and school fees are too high for me to meet. My parents can't fully cover expected expenses. My mother is unemployed due to health problems. That's why I need your help.


Monthly expences: 
300 euro - dormitory400 euro - living expances550 euro - school fees


= 1250 euro

A full year of studying in Munich costs 15000 euro.


Every cent counts. Make it possible!You can also help me by using the sharing tools available on this page to spread a word about my fundraiser .Thank you very much!
This campaign is ended, but I created another one. Here you can find it: 
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/butterfly-wings-part-2/x/11610432#/storyIf You have any questions feel free to contact me  : marcelina.liebner96@gmail.com w języku polskim : 
Kim jestem?
Nazywam się Marcelina. Mam 19 lat. Nie jestem w stanie określić, kiedy rozpoczęła się moja przygoda związana z  tańcem. W wieku 8 lat dołączyłam do grupy tańca TESS w moim mieście - Tarnowskich Górach. Z początku miałam bardzo luźny stosunek do zajęć. Z czasem taniec stał się moją pasją. Przebywanie na sali baletowej stało się  codziennością. Ciężka praca zaczęła się opłacać i dawała mi nie tylko satysfakcję, ale także liczne trofea.


Dlaczego taniec jest dla mnie wyjątkowy?
Ludzkie ciało jest w stanie pokazać mnóstwo emocji nie używając słów. Taniec jest niesamowitą sztuką ruchu. Umożliwia mi zachowanie harmonii w codziennym życiu oraz pomaga wyrazić pozytywne i negatywne stany emocjonalne. Właściwie nie wyobrażam sobie mojego życia bez tańca. Byłoby puste.


Jaki jest cel tej kampanii? 
Na początku tego miesiąca brałam udział w warsztatach, które były prowadzone przez instruktorów uczących w jednej z najlepszych szkół tańca w Europie - Iwanson International School of Contemporary Dance w Monachium. Prowadzący zauważyli mnie i zaproponowali, abym rozpoczęła edukację bez przechodzenia audycji. To niesamowita szansa, aby stać się profesjonalną tancerką, którą zawsze chciałam być. Niestety koszty utrzymania i czesne są zbyt wysokie. Rodzice nie są w stanie pokryć tych wydatków. Moja mama jest bezrobotna z powodów zdrowotnych. Dlatego proszę Was o pomoc!


Miesięczne wydatki:
300 euro - akademik
400 euro - dodatkowe koszty np.jedzenie
550 euro - czesne
= 1250 euro
Aby przez rok studiować w Monachium jest mi potrzebne 15000 euro.


Każdy grosz się liczy. Wszystko jest możliwe!
Możecie mi także pomoc udostępniając za pomocą przycisku dostępnego na tej stronie .
Dziękuję bardzo!

Jeśli macie jakieś pytania śmiało piszcie : 
marcelina.liebner96@gmail.com

story:
Hello Friends & Fellow Art Lovers!

Last year I began to work with a group of professional movers and current UWM dancers to join me in bringing this new concert into fruition. Auditions took place in February and cast began rehearsing in May.

The Gina Laurenzi Dance Project is now preparing to debut our first concert, Vagabondare: Wander, roam, stroll… , at the Danceworks Studio Theater in Milwaukee, WI. 

Vagabondare: Wander, roam, stroll… is a contemporary dance concert that is based off of my experiences traveling to different parts of Italy.

Saturday September 12th @ 6 pm & 8 pm

Sunday September 13th @ 3 pm

 @ Danceworks Studio Theater . 1661 N Water Street . Milwaukee, WI 53202 

Concert Synopsis:

Travel abroad with the artists of the Gina Laurenzi Dance Project. 

Choreographed by Gina Laurenzi, this performance hopes to move you from the mind of the traveler, into the shoes of the locals, and back again. Dancers get lost in the piazza, they find contemplative moments in museums, and then stumble through an adventure of odd experiences and interactions along the way. 

Meet the Performers

Kyra Boprie

Alberto Cambra

Andrea Carroll

Kendra Kramas

Emily Landry

Kelsey Lee

Brandie Lingo

Madeleine Schoch

Maggie Seer

Devin Settle

Bonnie Watson

Andrew Zanoni

Liz Zastrow

Follow the action

Keep up with the dancers of the Gina Laurenzi Dance Project, media blasts & rehearsal process in preparation for Vagabondare by liking us on Facebook @ https://www.facebook.com/ginalaurenziproject

We Need Your Kind Support

The goal is to raise $3000 to help pay dancers higher wages, assist in costuming costs as well as photographer/videographer costs. Anything you can contribute is super helpful to the success of this event and the production of future concerts.

If not this time, please help just by spreading the word and sharing your knowledge of our event :)

Either way, we hope to see you in the audience at Danceworks :)

story:
DRIGGproductions collaborates with composer Margel 'theSophant' & Arckatron of PlushLords Collective in the creation of three new works for the company's repertoire. Two of these works comprise a suite for live performance, while the third - 'FACADE' will be a video performance. 

'Smoke Lines' premiers in Jersey City on August 29th as DRIGGproductions' season opener. This show will run two nights at Nimbus Dance Works and serve as the company's first full evening performance. Dancers will be accompanied by live music performed by PlushLords.

‘Smoke Lines’ explores barriers. It is fear. It is you. It is me. It is the voice in our head that tells us we shouldn't, or we can't-  This is the ultimate barrier for everything. But it is right there, in plain sight, so easy, almost waiting for us to cross through it. Like vapor...like smoke.

'FACADE' is a piece musing on modern culture, hidden identity, and the loss of self-referral. In the fall of 2014, DRIGGproductions premiered 'FACADE' in New York City at the Ailey CitiGroup Theater. This summer we will take elements of that piece to create a new video performance with original music composed by Margel 'theSophant' & PlushLords. 

"These artists share in the exploration of emotional dimensions. Seeping and solid, all at once. "
                                                                             ~ Khadija Ahmaddiya, Co- Artistic Director

Support

As a growing company the arduous task of funding is constant, with all production costs covered out of pocket  by Co-Artistic Directors: Mark Caserta and Khadija Ahmaddiya.  

Our expenses range from paying artists for rehearsals, performances and travel, to venue rentals, wardrobe, set design, promotional material as well as the administrative costs of building our website, hosting our vimeo page & endless application fees.

After paying similar rates for participation in festivals we realized it would be more beneficial to produce our own full evening. Being selected for a space residency at Nimbus Dance Works  this spring proved the perfect opportunity to start the process.

Impact & Mission

'Smoke Lines' is a monumental step for DRIGGproductions as a company. By producing this show we will propel ourselves forward and expand our vision with new choreography, original music, and most importantly community engagement and new audience reach. DRIGGproductions has been creating short cinema and appearing in festivals through out New York and New Jersey,  since 2013 where we started as two dreamers creating movement in a tiny NYC apartment. 

Our goal is to produce work locally and internationally in the form of live performance and short cinema. We are committed to providing opportunity for the artistic growth process. At DRIGGproductions, we encourage artists to apply conscious thought to movement, individualism, social and cultural themes. 

Your support will not only make this show possible, but it will give us the kick start we need for sustainability and to reach future goals as a company. Please consider making a donation in support of all artists involved in DRIGGproductions. No amount is too small $5 - $500 means the world to us, for it shows that you believe! 

If you can not make a monetary donation, please donate a like, a shout out or introduce us to your rich friends!

With love & gratitude 

Khadija Ahmaddiya & Mark Caserta                                                                                               Co-Artistic Directors, DRIGGproductions

story:
I'm a California native, SFSU graduate, and the regional director of CORE40 fitness studios in San Francisco. I have a genuine interest for people, which includes those experiencing homelessness. I've spent time and money feeding the homeless and buying "Street Sheets" for over 7 years, but I've always known that one day I would do more to help. 

In a city like San Francisco where the divide between rich and poor continues to grow, the disconnected homeless population cannot afford to be castaways any longer. Homecoming SF is part community event, dance party, and fundraiser for the homeless.

I aim to celebrate the human gift of self expression through dance, music, and play with the entire community; not a select few. Redefining homelessness is a process that starts with understanding the power of self-worth and awareness.

What We Need 

My goal is to raise $100,000 before the Homecoming dance event in October. The funds raised will be used in the following ways:

1. Self-care packages with tangible items such as soap, socks, facial wipes, nail clippers, iPod shuffles, warm socks, & more for 1,000 homeless people in San Francisco.

2. Donation to Project Homeless Connect of San Francisco. PHC provides everyday services to individuals experiencing homelessness. "These services include dental care, eyeglasses, HIV testing, housing information, food, hygiene products, medical care, mental health services, SSI benefits, legal advice, California identification cards, voice mail accounts, employment counseling/job placement, wheelchair repair, addiction services, and more."

3. Donation to HandUp. HU allows users to donate directly to homeless neighbors in need. 

How it works:

 - Members in need sign up directly through community partners (like Project Homeless Connect). 

- Donors contribute directly to member goals.

- Members redeem their funds for basic needs.

4. The Homecoming dance will include performances, dance lessons, live music, and vendors. Everyone supporting the cause will be taking part in a new kind of social service; a service centered around music, dance, and play. 

The event and any funds raised are 100% not for profit. 

The Impact

With an abundance of non-profits seeking funding for their well-worthy agendas, it can be easy to oversee the good you can do for your very own community right in your own backyard. Not only will your contribution to Homecoming fuel an idea, it will benefit a human being you've crossed paths with many times before. The person that could have been you. 

I've travelled to numerous poverty stricken regions (India, Ghana, Burkina Faso just to name a few), but the division of wealth here in San Francisco is unlike anything I've ever seen. There are over 6,000 homeless people experiencing homelessness in San Francisco today.

In short, non-profit organizations like Project Homeless Connect are the future of transitioning people out of homelessness. With self-care comes self-worth, which is what medical, hygiene, and  personal services provide for humans; these services are the only innate differences between a modern era and an ancient one. 

Risks & Challenges

The cause & cure of homelessness is a topic big enough to hold an ocean. By starting somewhere and with a goal of self expression, an event like Homecoming can make a huge impact on attitudes towards homelessness in San Francisco. I aim to humanize the experience of homelessness in a way that everyone can relate to: dance, play, laughter, and music.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a place to contribute monetarily, spreading the word is like gold. Please share the Indiegogo link and event with your friends & social networks to foster engagement and contributions.

I'm also seeking volunteers for the Homecoming event in October (venue & date TBA). If you are an artist, dancer, or musician and wish to share your art for the cause, please get in touch with me at madsford22@gmail.com and tell me a little about yourself. 

When tickets go on sale for Homecoming, all proceeds will go to Project Homeless Connect. Please "like" the Homecoming Facebook page for updates on our epic venue & event details!

story:
Who we are?  

We are a group of Mexican women of different of ages, passionate for Mexican folkloric dance!  We have joined, because we believe that mexican values and traditions, can be transmitted through Mexican Folk Dance. 

With experience in different dance groups, international tours, national and local performances each member, has a wide career in Mexican folklore. 

Your support will let us represent our country one more time, with that love and pride that we feel when we perform each move and each song, from every region of our country. 

Mexico is color, is sound, is flavor. Mexico is dance, tradition and passion. The Folka's members want to transmit all this in Korea, this September, at Anseong Baudeogi Festival 2015.

We believe that we can share Mexican essence, make people get goosebumps with our dance, when we act out our feelings and represent proudly our beloved country!



Somos un grupo de mujeres de distintas edades, apasionadas por la Danza Foklórica Mexicana. Nos hemos unido porque creemos que los valores y tradiciones de nuestro país pueden ser transmitidos a través de la Danza Mexicana. 

Con experiencia en distintos grupos folklóricos, viajes internacionales, presentaciones nacionales y locales, cada uno de los y las integrantes, posee amplia trayectoria en el Folklore Mexicano. 

El apoyo al proyecto, nos permitirá representar a nuestro país, con ese orgullo y amor que sentimos al interpretar cada uno de los sones, danzas y bailes de cada región del país. 

México es color, es sonido, es sabor. México es danza, tradición y pasión. Las y los integrantes de Folka, queremos transmitir todo ello en Corea, en Septiembre de 2015. 

¡Creemos que con ello, podemos compartir la esencia de México, erizar la piel al bailar, al sentir, al representar orgullosamente a nuestro país!





How will we use the money?


The money raised will be used in: 

-80%:  Air ticket to Korea of each member (17,500 USD) 

-100%: Investment for whole clothing dance of each member ( 5000 USD) 

-100%:  Investment to uniform the group (shirt, sport pants, jacket, suitcase) (2,000 USD) 

-100%:  To rent the staging space, during 3 months  (500 USD) 

The rest is to pay this campaign and buy your perks. (See the graphic) 

If something is well known by Mexicans, is to be grateful. We have some perks, that we will give you with all our heart! (Check here)

Even if we don't reach the goal, every cent will be used for the same objective: Dancing in Korea. We don't have the whole money for that and for this reason, we would have to ask for fundings or cancel the trip of some members, in an extreme situation :( 



Lo recaudado en la campaña, será para la inversión de lo siguiente: 

- 80% del boleto de avión de cada integrante. (18,500 USD)

- 100% para inversión en vestuario de cada región de cada integrante (5,000 USD)

- 100% para inversión en uniforme de cada integrante (2,000 USD)

- 100% para la renta del espacio de ensayo. (500 USD) 

Lo restante es para el financiamiento de la propia campaña y la compra de tus recompensas. 

Si algo saben los mexicanos, es ser agradecidos. Tenemos algunas recompensas que de todo corazón podemos otorgarte.

Aunque no se logre la meta final, lo recaudado será utilizado para los mismos fines. No contamos con un presupuesto actualmente, lo que nos vería envueltos en solicitar créditos o cancelar la visita de algunos integrantes, en una situación extrema :(






The Impact! 

Mexico is a big country full of culture, that deserves to be shared and known around the world. The impact with this project is, precisely, to share our cultural heritage! 

Latin America, has high number of traditions, in many areas: gastronomy, religion, music and, of course, dance. Each country, each state and community, has a beautiful element to give and to show. 

We want to give a little part of this richness in other country, geographically to far from Mexico, we want to take away barriers, and make them feel live, happy, feel like a mexican in their own country!  

Sing with us!

"AY QUE BONITO ES VOLAR... A LAS 2 DE LA MAÑANA..."


México es un gran país, lleno de cultura que merece ser promovida y conocida por el mundo. El impacto generado con esta causa, es precisamente compartir la riqueza cultural. 

Latinoamérica, tiene muchas tradiciones en muchos aspectos: gastronomía, religión, música y por supuesto, danza. Cada país, estado, departamento o pequeña comunidad, tiene algo hermoso para dar y mostrar. 

Queremos dar una pequeña parte de esta riqueza en otro país, geográficamente lejos de México, queremos quitar las barreras y hacerlos sentir vivos, felices y contagiarlos, para hacerlos sentir como mexicanos en su propio país. 




Our Team! 

If you want to know about each member, visit the Gallery!


Risks and Challenges! 

We know the risks of this project! But we are sure, that our passion is stronger and we are convinced about represent our Mexico! We have a dream and we will reach it! 

We have a plan with specific important dates!, also we are rehearsing every day! (except on Sundays) 

We will sharing with you our rehearsing time! 


Sabemos los riesgos de no alcanzar el objetivo. Pero estamos convencidas que nuestra pasión es más fuerte y ¡estamos convencidas de representar nuestro México! Tenemos un sueño y vamos a cumplirlo. 
Ya hemos considerado las fechas importantes y ensayamos cada día (excepto en domingo) 
Estaremos compartiendo contigo nuestros momentos de ensayo.

El apoyo al proyecto, nos permitirá representar a nuestro país, con ese orgullo y amor que sentimos al interpretar cada uno de los sones, danzas y bailes de cada región del país. 
México es color, es sonido, es sabor. México es danza, tradición y pasión. Las y los integrantes de Folka, queremos transmitir todo ello en Corea, en Septiembre de 2015. 
¡Creemos que con ello, podemos compartir la esencia de México, erizar la piel al bailar, al sentir, al representar orgullosamente a nuestro país!





How will we use the money?

The money raised will be used in: 

-80%:  Air ticket to Korea of each member (17,500 USD) 
-100%: Investment for whole clothing dance of each member ( 5000 USD) 
-100%:  Investment to uniform the group (shirt, sport pants, jacket, suitcase) (2,000 USD) 
-100%:  To rent the staging space, during 3 months  (500 USD) 
The rest is to pay this campaign and buy your perks. (See the graphic) 
If something is well known by Mexicans, is to be grateful. We have some perks, that we will give you with all our heart! (Check here)
Even if we don't reach the goal, every cent will be used for the same objective: Dancing in Korea. We don't have the whole money for that and for this reason, we would have to ask for fundings or cancel the trip of some members, in an extreme situation :( 




Lo recaudado en la campaña, será para la inversión de lo siguiente: 
- 80% del boleto de avión de cada integrante. (18,500 USD)
- 100% para inversión en vestuario de cada región de cada integrante (5,000 USD)
- 100% para inversión en uniforme de cada integrante (2,000 USD)
- 100% para la renta del espacio de ensayo. (500 USD) 
Lo restante es para el financiamiento de la propia campaña y la compra de tus recompensas. 
Si algo saben los mexicanos, es ser agradecidos. Tenemos algunas recompensas que de todo corazón podemos otorgarte.
Aunque no se logre la meta final, lo recaudado será utilizado para los mismos fines. No contamos con un presupuesto actualmente, lo que nos vería envueltos en solicitar créditos o cancelar la visita de algunos integrantes, en una situación extrema :(








The Impact! 

 
Mexico is a big country full of culture, that deserves to be shared and known around the world. The impact with this project is, precisely, to share our cultural heritage! 
Latin America, has high number of traditions, in many areas: gastronomy, religion, music and, of course, dance. Each country, each state and community, has a beautiful element to give and to show. 
We want to give a little part of this richness in other country, geographically to far from Mexico, we want to take away barriers, and make them feel live, happy, feel like a mexican in their own country!  
Sing with us!
"AY QUE BONITO ES VOLAR... A LAS 2 DE LA MAÑANA..."

México es un gran país, lleno de cultura que merece ser promovida y conocida por el mundo. El impacto generado con esta causa, es precisamente compartir la riqueza cultural. 
Latinoamérica, tiene muchas tradiciones en muchos aspectos: gastronomía, religión, música y por supuesto, danza. Cada país, estado, departamento o pequeña comunidad, tiene algo hermoso para dar y mostrar. 
Queremos dar una pequeña parte de esta riqueza en otro país, geográficamente lejos de México, queremos quitar las barreras y hacerlos sentir vivos, felices y contagiarlos, para hacerlos sentir como mexicanos en su propio país. 



Our Team! 
If you want to know about each member, visit the Gallery!





Risks and Challenges! 

 
We know the risks of this project! But we are sure, that our passion is stronger and we are convinced about represent our Mexico! We have a dream and we will reach it! 
We have a plan with specific important dates!, also we are rehearsing every day! (except on Sundays) 
We will sharing with you our rehearsing time! 


Sabemos los riesgos de no alcanzar el objetivo. Pero estamos convencidas que nuestra pasión es más fuerte y ¡estamos convencidas de representar nuestro México! Tenemos un sueño y vamos a cumplirlo. 
Ya hemos considerado las fechas importantes y ensayamos cada día (excepto en domingo) 
Estaremos compartiendo contigo nuestros momentos de ensayo.

story:
The Play

A one woman, one act play written by C. R. Giles, The Also-Ran will premiere at this year's Edinburgh Fringe Festival.

Performing at:

Surgeons' Hall, Theatre 3, Edinburgh.

Monday 17th August - Saturday 22nd August 2015 (15.10 - 15.50)

("Adam Lindsay Gordon - Melbourne monument" by Paul Raphael Montford) 

Inspired by the life of 19th century poet-rebel Adam Lindsay Gordon, The Also-Ran gives voice to his long lost sweetheart Jane Brydges who recounts their lives together and apart, retelling the bittersweet highs and tragic lows of the maverick horse-rider turned bush ballad-monger whose talents may have lain elsewhere. 

The unheard past is brought to life and made anew in a soliloquy of lost imaginings and unfulfilled desire as Gordon’s lover comes to terms with the choices she made and the consequences she faced.


From the Writer: 

Having grown up in the Brydges' family farmhouse, Jane and Lindsay's love affair became an integral part of my childhood mythology. After years of research and many false starts I have finally found the perspective from which to tell their story and am at the stage of putting the play upon its feet.

I am reconciled to the fact that my writing is better then my own acting ability so it is time to hand the play over to those who can bring it alive with a little more panache. I have been helped by a wonderfully generous team of creatives and I am campaigning here to ensure that we can produce the best work possible and can give those artists the best possible support.


What We Need:

So far we have raised the money to hire the venue and secure the festival registration. Having taken advantage of family goodwill in order to cover accommodation we are still looking to raise the target amount of £2,500 which will be used to pay the following (and is inclusive of Indiegogo fees):

  • £1100 Actor / Director / Stage Manager fee
  • £150 Lighting Design / SFX
  • £150 Costume hire
  • £180 Rehearsal space hire in London
  • £500 Travel costs to Edinburgh
  • £195 Poster / flyer design/printing

Any contribution, however small or outrageously big, will be gratefully received; please do see the perks should you prefer carrots to sticks. We appreciate that giving hard cash is not always possible but if we could persuade you to spread the word about The Also-Ran to friends and strangers alike then the bums on seats, and general buzz, will be generosity enough.

The Team

We are very fortunate to have a highly experienced and dedicated team of creatives who have committed long hours for very little financial reward.


"Jane": Jen Holt
Trained at Central School of Speech and Drama. Theatre credits include: Macduff/First Witch/Duncan in Macbeth (The Orange Tree Theatre Richmond), Julia in Love’s Sacrifice, (Read Not Dead/ Shakespeare's Globe at Gray's Inn), Celanta in The Old Wive’s Tale (Read Not Dead/Shakespeare's Globe), Annabella in The Energy Show, (The Science Museum Live, No. 1 UK Tour), Maria Bertram / Susan Price in Mansfield Park  (Theatre Royal Bury St Edmunds, UK Tour), Juno / Julia in Dido Queen Of Carthage / King Lear, (Rep. at Greenwich Theatre, Lazarus Theatre Company), Liza in The Queen Of Spades (The Arcola), Octavia in Britannicus (Les Foules, The Roundhouse), Ada in The Black Veil (UK Tour), Clara in The White Devil (Lazarus Theatre Company), Olive in Flycatcher (Theatre 503),  Denise in Who will Carry The Word (The Courtyard Theatre), Celia in Volpone (The Humble Theatre), Clown in In / Scissions Festival (Escola de Clown de Barcelona), Clown in Present and Incorrect (Escola de Clown deBarcelona, Chisenhale Dance Space), Interviewer in Golden Lads and Lasses Must, (Blue Elephant Theatre),  Isabel / Letice in Restoration Showcase (Theatre Royal Haymarket), Nightingale in Firebrand (Royal and Derngate Theatres). Short Film credits include: Love and Budapest, the Advantages Of Being Colourblind, The Rose, Heathers, This Life. TV: The Iron Duke Unmasked, BBC2.


Director: Jason Lawson

Trained at L.A.M.D.A. Director credits include: Not A Game For Boys (Kings Head Theatre); Kissing Sid James (Jermyn Street Theatre, 59e59 St Theatre NYC, New Red Lion); Unimaginable and Some White Chick (Southwark Playhouse); Christmas Concerts (Chichester Festival Theatre); Charlie and Henry (New End); Danny’s Wake (New End, King’s Head, Sound Theatre, Edinburgh Pleasance); Huge (King’s Head, Edinburgh Pleasance); Sleeve Notes (Southwark Playhouse, Theatre503, Union); Some Afternoons, Red Sky, Blue Sky, Quinto Quarto (Union/Hen & Chickens, Bridge House Theatre); The Rose Garden (Union). Associate Director to David Leveaux: Passion Play (Duke of York Theatre) Backbeat (Ahmanson Theatre, Los Angeles; Royal Alexandra Theatre, Toronto; Duke of York Theatre) Resident Director: Women On The Verge of a Nervous Breakdown, director Bartlett Sher (Playhouse Theatre). Assistant Director credits: Arcadia (Broadway, NYC); Through A Glass Darkly (Atlantic Theater, NYC) both for director David Leveaux. In A Dark Dark House, director Michael Attenborough (Almeida); Nicholas Nickleby, directors Jonathan Church and Philip Franks (London, West End, Chichester Festival Theatre and UK tour); The Syndicate, director Sean Mathias (Chichester Minerva Theatre and UK tour); Triptych, director Sean Mathias; The Tempest, director Tom Wright; Romeo And Juliet, director Thomas Hescott (all Southwark Playhouse). Residency Director: Almeida Theatre, Old Vic Theatre. Director/Tutor: London School of Dramatic Art & Central School of Speech and Drama. 


Composer /  Sound Designer / Musician: Andy Philip 

A renowned session guitarist whose diverse  performance credits range from City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra to Australian X-Factor (with Ronan Keating and One Direction), from Brian May to Bucks Fizz. Resident guitarist on the West End show Wicked, he is an endorsee / demonstrator for Patrick James Eggle Guitars. Andy plays, composes and arranges for the progressive crossover group Doctor Gradus whose eponymous debut album was released worldwide of the French label Musea Records. He composed the soundtrack to the film Riga: Adazi Polygon premiered at the ICA, London, and works for the music production team Not the Same Lion.             


Writer: C. R. Giles 

Originally hailing from Kota Kinabalu, Borneo, C. R. Giles is a writer and performer. After training at The Arts Educational School, Tring, she has enjoyed a wide-ranging performance career from Hollywood (Alexander dir. Oliver Stone, Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire dir. Mike Newell) to the West End stage (Wicked and The Lion King) via the bard (A Midsummer Night's Dream, Regent's Park), contemporary dance at Sadler's Wells (Mahabarata) and The Greenwich Park Opera (Madame Butterfly and Tosca). Having taken time away from performing since the birth of her twins, her writing draws upon all these experiences and The Also-Ran marks her debut dramatisation. 


The Hope:

"Life is mostly froth and bubble,

Two things stand like stone.

Kindness in another's trouble,

Courage in your own."

Adam Lindsay Gordon


On a grand scale we hope The Also-Ran will bring some much deserved exposure to early Antipodean literature. A descendant of Clan Gordon of Esslemont and the only Australian to be honoured with a bust at Poet's Corner in Westminster Abbey, there is no better place then Edinburgh to receive Lindsay's theatrical homecoming. With your support we can introduce a forgotten historical figure to the festival's diverse and international audience.

On a personal note this shall be a grand achievement. An opportunity of a lifetime and a sickening delight to have one's words spoken out loud in a darkened theatre. 

Thank you for your time, your consideration and your support.

story:
Short Summary

Christian Youth Theater (CYT) is an after-school theater arts training program for students ages 4 - 18. Since its founding in 1981 in San Diego, CYT has grown to be the largest youth theater in the nation and is a non-profit 501(c)3 educational organization funded primarily through its tuition, ticket sales, and outside contributions.

Mission Statement: CYT is dedicated to developing character in children and adults through training in the arts and by producing wholesome family entertainment, all of which reflect Judeo-Christian values.

CYT Nashville will be embarking upon a new adventure this coming Fall. We will be moving from our original location into a better, more conducive facility that will help assist our creative students to grow and learn in a positive environment. Due to this change, our expenses have greatly increased.....and we need your help!

Increased costs include but are not limited to:

  • Facility Use for Fall
  • Real Theater for Production
  • Additional Classes=Additional Teachers=Additional Pay
  • Administrative Pay to keep things afloat 

What We Need & What You Get

Because CYT does not own facilities for classes or productions, the organization works through the local community, utilizing classrooms and stages in churches, schools and local theaters or studios. CYT is not affiliated with a church body, and people of all faiths are welcome. 

We located two wonderful facilities that are willing to assist with our needs and desires to improve locations and space for the students but it is coming at a cost. We are asking to help us raise $5,000 to offset the cost of these increased expenses.

In return, you have the potential to receive the following:

  • $50 free ticket to Fall Production
  • $100 free ticket to Fall Production + CYT T-shirt
  • $125 free ticket to Fall Production+ CYT T-shirt + Car Decal
  • $150 free ticket to Fall Production +CYT T-shirt +Car Decal+Priority Seating
  • $200+ free ticket to Fall Production+CYT T-shirt+Car Decal+Priority Seating+CYT pendent

The Impact

Our annual budget pays for costumes, sets, props, sound, lights, rental of theaters and classroom space, teacher stipends, artistic team stipends, curriculum writing and design, royalties and many other training and production costs. Only about 80% of the total comes from ticket sales and tuition and fees. CYT must raise support to ensure that all the productions and student programs are adequately funded. Philanthropic support is also critical to CYT to continue to make the program affordable. CYT has made a conscious effort to keep both tuition and ticket prices low, often providing scholarships, in order to make the program accessible for families throughout the Middle Tennessee area. Without charitable support, the CYT program could not be sustained at a reasonable cost to the students. Because the CYT program involves a new group of students every year – in addition to those who continue in the program – it is critically important for CYT to generate consistent sources of revenue. CYT is looking to the leaders of today, who truly believe that funds invested in youth is an investment in our future, which goes to the heart of the CYT mission. Charitable support allows CYT to grow and enhance the quality of the training and productions. A gift to CYT is an investment with an established, family-oriented organization that helps provide children a safe, wholesome environment and provides them with skills to make better life choices and become positive contributing members of their community.

Risks & Challenges

We have continued to increase registration as well as quality of our productions in lighting, sound, props and sets; all of which that cost a great deal of money. We had previously been offered a free place to call home for our program. As we continue on to our next scene, we will be taking on new expenses. We want to continue to grow in all aspects of our program but fear that if we are not able to maintain a minimal amount in the bank then our day-to-day expenses will not be kept up with. The money that we are asking for will cover partial costs of facilities in order for us to maintain the budget that was previously in place. All-in-all we are a non-profit organization that simply wants to stay afloat to be able to continue to offer this community to our loyal patrons and to continue to grow and touch new members.

story:
About Fuente Ovejuna

Abuse of power. Oppression of women. Rebellion. Sacrifice. Love. What does it take to start a revolution? It takes a village: Fuente Ovejuna.

Ducdame Ensemble is pleased to bring its inaugural USA production of this Lope de Vega classic to this year's New York International Fringe Festival. Based on historical events, come witness the uprising of 15th Century Spain's 99%. 

This adaptation of Fuente Ovejuna is directed by William Oldroyd (Winner of 2014 Best Short Film – Sundance) and originally premiered at the London Academy of Music & Dramatic Art.


Assistant Director- Ariana Karp

Producer- Michael J. Connolly


Cast:

Samantha Blinn

Brittany Chandler

Sam Gilroy

Cori Hundt

Alexander Kirby

Jane May

Tedra Millan

Brandon Petty

Kelly Strandemo

Saamer Usmani

Will Wilder


About Ducdame Ensemble

"What's that Ducdame?" Amiens asks in Shakespeare's As You Like It. "'Tis a Greek invocation, to call fools into a circle," Jaques replies. 

Just as Shakespeare used many of his "fools" to reveal truths, we at Ducdame Ensemble believe one must risk being foolish - by being bold, inquisitive, playful, unseemly, and unconventional - in order to find truth in art and bring it to life. Founded by graduates of the London Academy of Music & Dramatic Art, Ducdame Ensemble is committed to impassioned, relevant, and spirited storytelling where the play is always the thing. We invite you to step into our circle! 

About the New York International Fringe Festival

The New York International Fringe Festival (FringeNYC) is the largest multi-arts event in North America. It takes place over the course of two weeks every August and presents 200 companies from all over the world. The selection process is very competitive, accepting only 20% of their applicants from a pool of around 1,000 submissions. 

FringeNYC 2015 runs August 14 - 30th.

The Impact of Fuente Ovejuna

Considering gender disparity in art and media is hitting a tipping point, we find it crucial to reintroduce the rich plays of the Spanish Golden Age to American audiences. Spanish theatre was ahead of its time. While its contemporaries Elizabethan and Jacobean theatre barred women from the stage, Spanish theatres did not. By giving women the opportunity to perform it created a gender dialogue previously unseen in European theatre. Female roles became more truthful and relevant, tackling issues that could not be appropriately addressed when female roles were played by boys. As Penelope Cherns, head of the LAMDA Master’s program states; these are “cracking good stories, full of action and excitement…and they belong to the history of the Americas.” 

Based on actual events, Fuente Ovejuna tells the story of an oppressed 15th Century Castilian village that is still shockingly relevant today. In fact, as we rehearsed this play for its original production in London, an eerily similar event made headlines from India. In our version eleven actors play multiple roles using traditional elements of the Spanish Golden Age (split gender seating, live music, and flamenco dance) while simultaneously creating an intimate and visceral world full of both joy and terror. In less than 60 minutes, the audience will experience everything from the bliss of young love, to the discrepancy between the rich and poor, to the explosion of a community pushed to a boiling point and finally forced to seek retribution.

Founded in 1861, LAMDA is the oldest drama school in the UK and has recently produced some of today’s most sought after talent such as Benedict Cumberbatch, David Oyelowo, and Ruth Wilson. Unfortunately, America has lacked the opportunity to see these actors’ work at the start of their careers. We want to bring LAMDA home and share a piece of its training and philosophy with the New York theatrical community. Our company includes actors from the USA and abroad, some of whom will be returning to FringeNYC as others make their FringeNYC debuts.


Fundraising

In order to provide the justice we feel this gripping story deserves, we need funding to cover various production costs associated with performing at FringeNYC. We have created a very detailed budget which will help to cover the following expenses:

  • Rehearsal space
  • The FringeNYC application and participation fee
  • Set
  • Costumes
  • Props
  • Insurance
  • A guitarist
  • Travel expenses 
  • Website maintenance
  • PR
  • A stipend for the actors, producer, and assistant director
  • Legal fees associated with turning Ducdame Ensemble into a Unincorporated Association in time for FringeNYC 2015- with the eventual goal of becoming a Non-Profit 501 (3)(c) Theatre Company

Every contribution is greatly appreciated and gets us another step closer towards achieving our goal- no matter how big or small.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute financially at this time, please help get the word out about our campaign! You can explore the links below to find us on social media.
story_txt:
About Fuente Ovejuna

Abuse of power. Oppression of women. Rebellion. Sacrifice. Love. What does it take to start a revolution? It takes a village: Fuente Ovejuna.
Ducdame Ensemble is pleased to bring its inaugural USA production of this Lope de Vega classic to this year's New York International Fringe Festival. Based on historical events, come witness the uprising of 15th Century Spain's 99%. 
This adaptation of Fuente Ovejuna is directed by William Oldroyd (Winner of 2014 Best Short Film – Sundance) and originally premiered at the London Academy of Music & Dramatic Art.

Assistant Director- Ariana Karp
Producer- Michael J. Connolly

Cast:
Samantha Blinn
Brittany Chandler
Sam Gilroy
Cori Hundt
Alexander Kirby
Jane May
Tedra Millan
Brandon Petty
Kelly Strandemo
Saamer Usmani
Will Wilder


About Ducdame Ensemble
"What's that Ducdame?" Amiens asks in Shakespeare's As You Like It. "'Tis a Greek invocation, to call fools into a circle," Jaques replies. 

Just as Shakespeare used many of his "fools" to reveal truths, we at Ducdame Ensemble believe one must risk being foolish - by being bold, inquisitive, playful, unseemly, and unconventional - in order to find truth in art and bring it to life. Founded by graduates of the London Academy of Music & Dramatic Art, Ducdame Ensemble is committed to impassioned, relevant, and spirited storytelling where the play is always the thing. We invite you to step into our circle! 

About the New York International Fringe Festival
The New York International Fringe Festival (FringeNYC) is the largest multi-arts event in North America. It takes place over the course of two weeks every August and presents 200 companies from all over the world. The selection process is very competitive, accepting only 20% of their applicants from a pool of around 1,000 submissions. 

FringeNYC 2015 runs August 14 - 30th.



    The Impact of Fuente Ovejuna

Considering gender disparity in art and media is hitting a tipping point, we find it crucial to reintroduce the rich plays of the Spanish Golden Age to American audiences. Spanish theatre was ahead of its time. While its contemporaries Elizabethan and Jacobean theatre barred women from the stage, Spanish theatres did not. By giving women the opportunity to perform it created a gender dialogue previously unseen in European theatre. Female roles became more truthful and relevant, tackling issues that could not be appropriately addressed when female roles were played by boys. As Penelope Cherns, head of the LAMDA Master’s program states; these are “cracking good stories, full of action and excitement…and they belong to the history of the Americas.” 


Based on actual events, Fuente Ovejuna tells the story of an oppressed 15th Century Castilian village that is still shockingly relevant today. In fact, as we rehearsed this play for its original production in London, an eerily similar event made headlines from India. In our version eleven actors play multiple roles using traditional elements of the Spanish Golden Age (split gender seating, live music, and flamenco dance) while simultaneously creating an intimate and visceral world full of both joy and terror. In less than 60 minutes, the audience will experience everything from the bliss of young love, to the discrepancy between the rich and poor, to the explosion of a community pushed to a boiling point and finally forced to seek retribution.


Founded in 1861, LAMDA is the oldest drama school in the UK and has recently produced some of today’s most sought after talent such as Benedict Cumberbatch, David Oyelowo, and Ruth Wilson. Unfortunately, America has lacked the opportunity to see these actors’ work at the start of their careers. We want to bring LAMDA home and share a piece of its training and philosophy with the New York theatrical community. Our company includes actors from the USA and abroad, some of whom will be returning to FringeNYC as others make their FringeNYC debuts.


Fundraising
In order to provide the justice we feel this gripping story deserves, we need funding to cover various production costs associated with performing at FringeNYC. We have created a very detailed budget which will help to cover the following expenses:

Rehearsal space
The FringeNYC application and participation fee
Set
Costumes
Props
Insurance
A guitarist
Travel expenses 
Website maintenance
PR
A stipend for the actors, producer, and assistant director
Legal fees associated with turning Ducdame Ensemble into a Unincorporated Association in time for FringeNYC 2015- with the eventual goal of becoming a Non-Profit 501 (3)(c) Theatre Company

Every contribution is greatly appreciated and gets us another step closer towards achieving our goal- no matter how big or small.

story:
ABOUT US:

Hello dedicated artists or art lovers! We are the Artist's Sandbox and we are a New York ensemble that strives to awake and nurture the inner child in every artist, giving them the playground they need to feel artistically challenged in a safe and freeing environment. We are dedicated to establishing a hub for artists to work creatively and cohesively towards a sometimes uncommon goal.

Alex Nicholson, the Founder and Artistic Director of the Artist's Sandbox, came from Canada in 2011 to study at Circle in the Square Theatre School, where he graduated in 2013 with a concentration in musical theatre. He jumped right into the theatre scene, and has in the past 2 years performed in many different venues. However, he's now reached a point where he feels as though he's plateaued, simply because he's lost the artistic inspiration and drive that he had when he graduated. He recently realized that if he feels this way, there's probably a lot of other artists of many different persuasions, talents, and concentrations, who feel the same. So, he sat on it, and found a way that artists as a community could exercise their artistic brain in a way that isn't currently available. 

Lets create a strictly non-union company where all artists come together. A company where a singer, an actor, a designer, a director, and a painter, could work together on a dance piece. By creating a structure where a company has many branches, it allows artists to either expand and grow from what they already love in a safe and nurturing environment OR try something new! Whether it be on your own, or with a mentor in another branch.

When you audition for this company and are invited in, you are a member of all branches. You may do a dance show one year, but then a straight play the next. We know that we can make a difference and create a path of artistic fulfillment for many people in this city. But that's where all of you come in!


What We Need & What You Get:

We are looking to raise $9, 360 USD to fund our first season. These costs will allow us to pay for:

- performance spaces for all 3 shows

- rehearsal spaces for all 3 shows

- costumes, props, and set for all 3 shows

- insurance for the company

- our casts and crews

- rights for our first show



Our Season:


You Are Here by Daniel MacIvor- December 2015

You are about to meet Alison, who searches her life for meaning in this remarkable and powerful play. In a series of luminous moments and encounters, we're drawn into Alison's world: love that fades, hopes that die, and enduring friendship that offers the promise of redemption. You are Here is a daring, intimate and profound theatrical experience, and we are so excited to give this great Canadian play life in New York!

Learning to Stand on Your Own Two- March 2016

When you are even conceived, you're connected to someone. You grow up into a family, and from that family you make friends and create relationships. Very few times in life do you give yourself enough time with yourself to figure out who you are and where you stand in this world. This piece is a journey of creating and becoming yourself, and learning how to be alone without being lonely. 

Lilith and Eve- April 2016

With the mythology of Adam and Eve and Lilith, we are attempting to explore the archetypes of masculinity and femininity: what does it mean to be a man or woman or even human? This interpretive and original work will reexamine the creation myth and allow us to create our own mythology. What can we rediscover about our own origins?


THANK YOU!

We understand not everybody can donate money but you can still make a difference for us as a new and hopeful company. Getting the word out there in as many ways as possible will also help us grow. Share our link and talk up our company on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, at work, at school or anywhere else you can!

We appreciate you all for taking the time to check out our site and we hope to create a great relationship with each and every one of you!

- The Artist's Sandbox Family

story:
COSMIC CREATRIX DANCE AS A MASTERPIECE

INTRODUCTION
Hello everyone! Namaste! 
We are delighted to introduce us to you, Theodorus Ramdjiet Kishna and Ronald Suresh Kishna, artists brothers • artistic directors @ Arangart® foundation in south India.  Born and grew up in Suriname-South America and in Amsterdam The Netherlands-West Europe. We studied in India, the original historical classical Bharata Natyam dance and music art. We have dedicated a great part of our life to study, research and conservation of this stage art, created and codified by the ancient Tanjore Quartet Art House of traditional masters in dance and music, from which all forms take their source.
In the past decades we have staged in Europe and India this comprehensive dance art, that is a union of several art forms; dance, music, the art of expression, drama, costume and make-up design. Now in India we established the non-profit art foundation Arangart® to document further this disappearing and valuable art, to provide a free dance education to talented children/youngsters without sufficient finance, stimulate talent of upcoming young dancers/artists, to collaborate with other art foundations and artists for cultural exchange and creative crossovers. The goal is to create a self sufficient low-cost-green atelier, a multiple studio-stage-costume-set design space.

With our South East Asian tour we aim to create awareness of this disappearing historical art, to introduce the art to wider audiences, the world of dance, and to make the art foundation Arangart visible.

We are in a fast world were many valuable traditional arts and crafts are disappearing or become unknown. The authentic school became artistically instant. The tranquility, well structured, strong, highly stylised and precise way of staging the art with an unpredictable choreography are a few features that are now lost. We began with the documentation of the dance choreographs and the tailor made music for the love of the art and due to above meant reasons. At first with the guidance of one of the last brilliant maestro's of the Tanjore Quartet Art House, the multiple awarded Prof. Mr. K. P. Kittappa Pillai, and after his demise in collaboration with his son master K. Chandrasekaran-Kittappa Pillai and the singer/musicians connected with the Tanjore Quartet Art House. 

Your support is utmost important! Continuation of this valuable traditional art  is needed to keep the art alive not only for the love of art but for the world of dance, to inspire and bring about the UNLIMITED CREATIVITY within us and within other artists around the world. Imagine how much new contemporary artwork can be created with a comprehensive art form developed with care and nurtured by their creators through the ages. Your contribution will make this multi creative project a success and will be a leap forward towards our other goals.

What do we need from our contributors around the world
As multi tasking artists, we are now in a start up position to make the aim of this project and Arangart visible. We are able to produce the designing work for costumes assisted by the upcoming young fashion designer Suresh Menon, promotional material, set design and editing the music ourselves. The live music is recorded and stored on the iPad. This reduces the expenses and makes it easy to travel with our art and a high quality “life” music. 

To achieve our goal of this unique project a total amount of $8450 US dollars is at least needed. We have made an estimation of the expenses to prepare the project and expenses to carry out the project.

Preparation expenses: $3765

  • Music recording: $728 -  rental music studio, adjusted fees vocalist, drummer, violin, conductor.    
  • Costumes: $1000 - 4 pieces of costumes - material and partly tailoring.
  • Set Design: material and making charges: $500
  • Make up material: $437
  • Studio rent: $600 - rehearsals 
  • Promotional material: $500 - brochures, visiting cards, flyers, posters.

Costs to carry out the project: $4686

  • Travel Expenses: $1686 - flight tickets and taxi for the South East Asia tour
  • Accommodation: $700 
  • Fees: $2000 - adjusted fees for two dance artists/make up artist 
  • Unexpected expenses $300 

Every contribution is much appreciated and will be rewarded! All names of our contributors will be mentioned on our promotional materials! Depending of your contribution we will reward you with a special designed perk! For those who love our project but are not able to contribute we kindly request them to spread out the news to their friends, family and relatives who can support us! Please JUST SHOUT IT OUT! and use the Indiegogo share tools. At the end of the project our contributors will be the first to see an excerpt of our performances, we will share the video through youtube/vimeo.

  • Contribution of $10 will receive a special designed THANK YOU card by email. 
  • Contributions of $25  a set of 3 GraphicArtPostcards from shots taken during one of our performances printed on handmade paper and a SHOUT OUT on our Facebook page.
  • Contribution of $55 our featured perk, a special fashionable high quality organic cotton t-shirt that will be send to your doorsteps packed in handmade recyclable package. Your name will be mentioned on our FB page with a SHOUT OUT. The T-shirt is designed by us and manufactured by Shree Kailash Apparels in Tamil Nadu state, a company specialised in manufacturing for large charitable foundations. Although they accept only big orders they were very kind to support us with our project. 

In case we can not reach our complete funding we will organise a free dance education workshop for talented children/youngsters without sufficient finance to learn a classical art and staging of one performance in Mumbai or Bali. The performances are planned to be staged between July and September 2016.

This is our first crowd funding project which was advised by a friend in New York, United States and the challenge is to see the prepared work of this Indiegogo crowd funding campaign translated into your contribution to reach our goal!

THANK YOU!

GREETINGS! NAMASTE!
