story:
I am a native from Martinique and I have been living in Europe for thirty four years. I left Martinique very young to become a dancer and that's what happened! I have studied dance in Paris and in Brussels and started my career as a dancer in London and then in Lyon, France, before travelling to Italy. I fell in love with this beautiful country and I met my husband with who I work occasionally. I am not a dancer anymore and I work as a freelance Ballet Master and I am embarking on the path of choreography, I am therefore a young choreographer though I already staged different dance pieces.

 

I launch this campaign to raise money to face part of the costs of the production for my choreographic work which is about identity.

This project means a lot to me because I was born and raised until I was sixteen in Martinique, where the questioning about identity has been a long and difficult path for the natives of the island.
This theme is central in Europe and North America and my project involves artists from Europe and Martinique and will be created between Italy and the Caribbean.

In fact I will work with two italian dancers and two martiniquan dancers in Italy and then we will create the show in Martinique in March 2018, then will follow a tour in Guadeloupe and in french Guyana before traveling back to Italy, where we will perform.

If you choose to help us with a donation, even small, it will be a great gesture that will bring us closer to our goal and and you will help an idea and an artistic project to take shape and to achieve.

 

We will need 3000 euros to pay the flights from Italy to Martinique, for two dancers and myself, in fact the flight expenses are very high and our supporters don't pay them.

If 300 of you make a donation of 10 euros we can reach our goal very soon and cope with major spending in our budget. 

Once travels to and from Italy paid, we ensure the opportunity to create the show in Martinique and to be able to represent it in Italy.

It is important to reach our goal, 3000 euros, otherwise the funds will be reimbursed to donors and we won't have the opportunity to travel to Martinique.

 

This project is important to us and we are passionate about it because it contains notions such as self-representation and self-consciousness.

It is of utmost importance not only to the Western world especially at this historic moment in which a war is fought to affirm a religious identity and a sense of belonging.

We will discuss the subject from the philosophical thoughts expressed by Gilles Deleuze and Félix Guattari from which Edouard Glissant, poet and philosopher of Martinique, is inspired to express his concept of plural identity, in opposition to a unique root identity.

 

We have to find at least 300 donors and we risk not reaching our goal and therefore not be able to cope with travel expenses to fly to Martinique but we want to make everyone aware of the issue we will face and its importance.

We will organize meetings during which you can discuss with us and ask us all the questions you will want about the project and its implementation.

We will campaign on social media to spread the voice and strengthen our intent and actively engage the associations dealing with identity, gender and sexual orientation and meet the French expatriates in Italy to make them aware of our project and the identity issue.

Please if you can't donate make some noise about our campaign and share using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you all!

story:
My name is Carrie Ellmore-Tallitsch.  I am a performing artist, Yogini, Reiki practitioner, teacher, choreographer, and earth/environment advocate.  I am also the co-founder of P.E.A.C.E. Community Garden in Jersey City, New Jersey at St. Paul’s Lutheran Church since 2012. The garden produces organic produce for the community and local food pantry and is a part of an emerging eco-village committed to urban permaculture, eco-art, and composting.

I am working on a performance installation at a magical outdoor alley way in Princeton New Jersey called Dohm Alley www.dohmalley.org  

I want to create an interactive abstract exhibit based on conscience collaborative co-existence with plants and weeds.  The excessive use of chemical sprays on lawns, gardens, and public green spaces is negatively affecting all life on the planet.  I hope to educate and inspire the community to reflect upon the choices we make that directly impact the planet. 

"Within and In Between" will take place at the end of July 2018.  This will require a handful of collaborating artists to make this project viable. The goal of raising $4000 will help to hire a local composer, cinematographer/editor, and costume designer.  Your donation will help financially support the artists, this important message, and the cost for advertising/information pamphlets and extra installation equipment.  

The film aspect of the project will be the most intensive and costly because of the multiple angles, camera equipment, and editing.  Having the finished film will allow documentation, and another artistic expression to live on.  

This is the first of many other site specific installations regarding important environmental issues.  

I have been reaching out to Beyond Pesticides, an environmental conservation agency in Washington D.C. that serves to help educate and offer tools for safer options of lawn care and more.  By donating to "Within and In Between" you will also be helping me purchase pamphlets and information sheets from this agency for the installation. 

The time is now that artists everywhere use the power of creative vision to inspire change in the world one locality at a time.  Please consider a donation!  If it is not possible to donate monetarily, please pass on this campaign.  There are many other ways to help.  You may also help by volunteering or offering a skill that is needed.  

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this campaign!  May you be happy and healthy!

story:
What WDMC and Queens Shakespeare Are Up To Now

After another critically acclaimed season in 2017 Queens Shakespeare, in partnership with What Dreams May Co., returns to the stage for presentations of Godspell (Book: John Michael Tebelak, Music and new lyrics by Stephen Schwartz) and Henry IV by William Shakespeare (parts I and II combined). Join us for a season of epic stories. First up, Godspell.

Director Christina Sheehan’s modern revolutionary inspired design explores a diverse group with many modern voices of resistance who come together with one visionary leader to form a community, and ultimately learn how to make their own “light” shine. This popular musical retelling of the Gospel of Matthew brings its messages of kindness, tolerance and love vibrantly to life.

We invite you to join the tribe, as they work together in the hope of building their…Beautiful City.

 

Why Do We Need Your Help?

We are doing our very first musical!!!! We are SO EXCITED about this big new adventure, and YOU can help us face all the new challenges involved! Here's a breakdown of what you can do:

If you donate $90 you will be covering the price of a week of rehearsals.

If you donate $150 you will be covering the price of our programs.

If you donate $200 you will be covering the price of our photographer.

If you donate $1000 you will cover half a weekend of performances.

If you donate $2000 you will cover a full weekend of performances.

A contribution of any size will help us to make things happen, and makes you a part of the artistic process! So choose your favorite perk and join the team!

Who Is WDMC?

Founded in 2011, What Dreams May Co. is dedicated to making the classics accessible to all. We believe that the beauty of the language and the deeply human themes that Shakespeare used are still entirely relevant today. We remain true to these important foundations and use them to create a world audiences can recognize as their own, populated with characters that reflect the diverse community we live in. By holding the mirror up to the nature of our world as it is now, we can gain a deeper understanding of the words that have been handed down to us from centuries past.

Who Is Queens Shakespeare?

Founded in 2005 by Nanette Asher, Queens Shakespeare, Inc. is a not-for-profit professional theatrical company, which serves Queens County and the greater New York City area. Its aim is to act as a laboratory for actors of all ages and experience levels to explore classical works and to perform in fully produced, accessible, and innovative productions. Each season one production is developed as an educational tour which is then presented at different venues throughout the state. Producing and touring in this fashion allows the company to actively contribute to the growth and vibrancy of the developing Queens arts scene, while at the same time exposing classical works to modern audiences through the educational tour.

 

Your friends at WDMC and Queens Shakespeare,

Chrissy and Jonathan
story_txt: What WDMC and Queens Shakespeare Are Up To NowAfter another critically acclaimed season in 2017 Queens Shakespeare, in partnership with What Dreams May Co., returns to the stage for presentations of Godspell (Book: John Michael Tebelak, Music and new lyrics by Stephen Schwartz) and Henry IV by William Shakespeare (parts I and II combined). Join us for a season of epic stories. First up, Godspell.Director Christina Sheehan’s modern revolutionary inspired design explores a diverse group with many modern voices of resistance who come together with one visionary leader to form a community, and ultimately learn how to make their own “light” shine. This popular musical retelling of the Gospel of Matthew brings its messages of kindness, tolerance and love vibrantly to life.We invite you to join the tribe, as they work together in the hope of building their…Beautiful City. Why Do We Need Your Help?We are doing our very first musical!!!! We are SO EXCITED about this big new adventure, and YOU can help us face all the new challenges involved! Here's a breakdown of what you can do:If you donate $90 you will be covering the price of a week of rehearsals.If you donate $150 you will be covering the price of our programs.If you donate $200 you will be covering the price of our photographer.If you donate $1000 you will cover half a weekend of performances.If you donate $2000 you will cover a full weekend of performances.A contribution of any size will help us to make things happen, and makes you a part of the artistic process! So choose your favorite perk and join the team!Who Is WDMC?Founded in 2011, What Dreams May Co. is dedicated to making the classics accessible to all. We believe that the beauty of the language and the deeply human themes that Shakespeare used are still entirely relevant today. We remain true to these important foundations and use them to create a world audiences can recognize as their own, populated with characters that reflect the diverse community we live in. By holding the mirror up to the nature of our world as it is now, we can gain a deeper understanding of the words that have been handed down to us from centuries past.Who Is Queens Shakespeare?Founded in 2005 by Nanette Asher, Queens Shakespeare, Inc. is a not-for-profit professional theatrical company, which serves Queens County and the greater New York City area. Its aim is to act as a laboratory for actors of all ages and experience levels to explore classical works and to perform in fully produced, accessible, and innovative productions. Each season one production is developed as an educational tour which is then presented at different venues throughout the state. Producing and touring in this fashion allows the company to actively contribute to the growth and vibrancy of the developing Queens arts scene, while at the same time exposing classical works to modern audiences through the educational tour. Your friends at WDMC and Queens Shakespeare,Chrissy and Jonathan

story:
Seeking Intimacy was originally performed through Freshblood New Writing student society in July 2017. It was staged in promenade in various locations around the Oculus building on Warwick University campus.

We built the show through a series of workshops that involved both the lead actors, a non-auditioned ensemble and members of Warwick Anti-Sexism and Pride societies who offered advice and insight on the issues and themes surrounding intimacy as the project progressed. It was an incredibly rich and rewarding experience, and we received some really useful and positive feedback from the NSDF selector. We were surprised, although delighted to find out that it had been chosen to be performed at the National Student Drama Festival this year!

The National Student Drama Festival is an annual festival where 14-16 productions each year are selected from universities and colleges across Britain. Alumni include Stephen Fry, Meera Syal and Harold Pinter.  It's an unparalleled opportunity for student work to be showcased in front of other young makers and industry professionals, as well as to participate in workshops and discussions run by said professionals.

Taking a 13-strong cast and crew to Leicester does incur a significant cost, with tickets and accommodation totalling £3,000. Everything we raise from this fundraiser will be used to subsidise each person's ticket cost (£100 each) and accommodation cost (£116 each)

Whatever donation you can give, big or small, is appreciated a huge amount. We'll be sending updates from rehearsals and our journey to Leicester!

story:
Natural Wonders and Awkward Conversations

Imagine a man, a writer, lost in mid life, as he drives across the American West with his estranged stepdaughter-a young woman at the beginning of hers. In a series of increasingly desperate attempts to rescue something from the wreckage of divorce, they test how much they can trust each other, or whether that will ever be possible again.

Who We Are

This compelling play touches on vivid themes of the contemporary American family, and offers the actors career changing roles. Dexter Knowlton Strong as 'Monkey Man' and Sara Brown as 'Bitch' met during actor training sessions at the Freeman Studio in NY city and are developing a strong connection as working partners in early rehearsals. 

The author, Lee Blessing, is a playwright with numerous international credits. His  Pulitzer-nominated work A Walk in the Woods was produced last year at the Barrow Street Theater in Manhattan. Surprisingly, we are the first team to present Great Falls in New York City.

New York theater veteran Bill Buell is directing. His credits as an actor on stage and screen include roles in Broadway productions of Equus and Cyrano, and films such as Across the Universe and the Netflix original Lucky 7.

We have already booked our space! The Actor's Theater Workshop on 28th St in Manhattan will host our two week run. Click HERE for more about their great work. 

Your financial support will cover the cost of renting this beautiful space as well projection equipment rental, scenic materials, crew stipends, licensing fees, insurance  and promotional expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We aim to raise $14,000 to fully realize this project. Our largest expenses are rental fees for the venue, (for which we have already made a deposit) and scenic video projection. This element is essential for capturing the visual power of the landscape, allowing it to become an important character within the narrative. If we exceed our fundraising goal we will simply expand the production capacity of the projection element by using a more advanced equipment set up. Content will not change, delivery will. 
  • If we do not meet our goal we will still mount a powerful production. Blessing's spare economy as a writer has enough impact to bring the essential qualities of these places into the imagination. If parts of cinematic component have to be cut for budget reasons we will still be successful in bringing to life the nuanced world these characters inhabit. 
  • We want to show our gratitude with a number of fun perks, including weekend getaways, local sailing trips, vintage postcards, private yoga classes, culinary delights and free tickets for each of the eight performances. Any contribution amount is welcome, and we will be sure to mention you prominently in the Playbill. 

Why now, why us?

  • This will be the first time that Great Falls has been produced in New York City, and it is exciting to be part of the effort that brings these characters to life in the heart of the American theater.
  • In doing so, this showcase will highlight the emerging talents of Dexter Knowlton Strong and Sara Brown, newcomers to the New York stage, and a successful run will position them to grow their careers on both stage and screen. 
  • Thematically, this play remains relevant to the current discussions around the #MeToo movement in nuanced ways. Blessing's characters wrestle with these issues in countless surprising ways, so please join us in delving into this complex conversation. 

Risks & Challenges

Producing a successful dramatic production is full of challenges. Logistically, artistically, financially, filling seats---the list is long. With your help, we can overcome these challenges

  • Our venue, Actor's Theater Workshop, is a well-respected not-for-profit black box facility on 28th street in the heart of Manhattan. Close proximity to the industry will ensure a maximum number of theater professionals have access to our production.
  • Tickets are available now and will help monitor the effectiveness of our publicity outreach. Get your seats HERE
  • Our producer's previous work as a production designer and technical director qualifies him to oversee the logistics of producing this play.
  • Our networks will sustain a comprehensive social media and publicity campaign that will fill seats. Between the cast and crew we run the gamut from NY theater veterans, dedicated donors like you, and younger ambitious theater makers. 
  • We have built and will continue to build a great team of creative collaborators to manage sound and video design, and we've also compiled a well trained running crew from Dexter's days teaching technical theater. Check out our website for details about our creative team and the production effort as it unfolds on our BLOG.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute we understand, but we're grateful for anything else you can think of. Please share info about this project through any and all means.

  • Please tell your friends and share our stories on Instagram @GreatFallsThePlay and Face Book http://www.facebook.com/greatfallstheplay/!

story:
OUR SUMMARY

  We are Project Light!

Vision: To be and reflect light among the masses.

Mission: We are a reflection of women whose initiative is to shine bright enough that it offers permission and energy to all women to become their most powerful self.

We Speak Possible

We Offer Hope

We Stand Whole & Complete

Project Light consists of Atlanta, Georgia local performing artists, JRenee, Kamaria Sauda, and Denell Porche' who are inspired by the importance for women to be guided by their best self, celebrating through their own individual expression.

JRenee hails from Baltimore, Maryland who is a poet, author, recording artist and actress. Kamaria Sauda from Prince George's County, Maryland is a vocalist, recording artist, song writer and a music therapist.  Denell Porche' whose hometown is Cincinnati, Ohio is a poet, author, and vocalist. 

The Atlanta Black Theatre Festival hosts annually 40 plays in 4 days, October 3rd -6th, 2018, selecting scripts from around the world to perform on stage. Project Light for the 2018 year will be performing October 4th, 2018 at 7 pm at the Porter Sanford III Performing Arts Center. For more information please visit https://atlantabtf.org/black-box-plays . 

“As with the body and in life, there are many parts creating the whole, living experience to execute every mission.”

We are asking for your financial support. This is our debut performance at the Atlanta Black Theater Festival as Project Light collective! No amount is too small and no support will be turned away! Donations will go towards cost of producing the show, including but not limited to 

Marketing

Set Design

Costume Design

Artists

Musicians

Merchandise

Venue Costs

Festival Fees

Visual/Sound for the Night

story:
Project Summary

We at Outlet Ensemble started putting up plays as new artists in the New York theatre scene with a hunger to practice and work in our craft. With each production we have grown more and more ambitious and want to give back to the community through the pieces that we present. 

The lens through which we are presenting our upcoming project, Brilliant Traces by Cindy Lou Johnson, is that of exploring dissociative disorder, depression, dementia, generalized anxiety and other ailments of the mind with a compassionate, humor helps heal type attitude. 

With your help we can put up quality, conscientious work that provides a stigma-free environment and allows tough subject matter to be not only palatable to as wide an audience as possible, but help facilitate the conversation on how we can help and spread awareness.

We also want to donate %5 of our ticket sales to a worthy organization that helps continue the conversation and provide help to those who are struggling. With your donation, we can produce a platform that can help in the best way we know how. 

What We Need & What You Get

The campaign goal is $7,000 which is just under 60% of our total budget for the show. The other 40% is coming from funds that were earned from our previous production, Uncle Vanya adapted by Kevin Gay.

This money is going directly to the purchasing and construction of the set, sound & lighting equipment, costumes, music & composition and the people who collaborate on stringing all of these design elements together to put on a show. It is also going towards promotion materials, rehearsal rentals and rental of the performance space. All of these moving parts come together to create quality entertainment with a compassionate heart and the spirit to spread awareness through dialogue. We want to share that with you!

This is a quirky, fun show with an emotional awareness and sympathetic soul and we have the team to match! We want to entertain our audiences and we want you to join us on this journey!

If we don't reach our entire goal, the money will still go to all of the elements of the production, but may not get all of the resources they deserve. However, the show must go on, and we are determined to see this project through while spreading compassion with our storytelling. Either way, we hope to see you there!

The Impact

When you contribute to this campaign you are contributing to support a diverse group of artists dedicated to help the community through practicing what they love. We include compensation for all of the artists we work with, and the material they provide us with. For Uncle Vanya we commissioned a playwright for a the brand new adaptation we presented as well as an artist to do the promotional art, as well as utilized original music (played live) from the emerging band Boy Band. For Gruesome Playground Injuries we took artists fresh out of college and gave them a paid platform to practice their art. 

Even for this project we have already commissioned a fabulous artist, Tasha Gross, for her work which you see on this very campaign. On top of that, for this project we have a specific vision to help spread awareness of certain mental health issues. Hopefully have enough momentum and a large enough audience to also raise funds to help in the monetary sense as well with a 5% ticket sales donation to an organization that directly helps people.  

Our last two very successful, full-scale productions, Uncle Vanya (Spring 2017) and Gruesome Playground Injuries (Spring 2016), were made possible through campaigns just like this. We are asking, yet again, for your help

Gruesome Playground Injuries (Spring 2016)

Uncle Vanya (Spring 2017)

Risks & Challenges

When finances are tight, one of the first things to suffer is our promotion. This is the longest run (7 performances) that we're doing, to date. That being said, we want to be able to fill the house and share the collective vision of our team with as many people as possible. These funds help provide not only the practical tools directly related to the mounting of the production, but the promotional tools we need to spread our word on our production and message of compassion in relation to mental health struggles. 

With these funds we are going to promote in schools and in the theatrical community and beyond to help get the word out. As a new company it's difficult to build a loyal audience, but with each passing production, more and more people are entertained as well as impassioned by what we are doing and where we want to go. We want to continue to provide the best quality product that we possibly can to continue this organic growth. Hopefully, and with your help, we can bring to the table tough conversations in a beautiful yet pragmatic way.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even $5 goes such a long way, but if you are unable to donate, that's ok! We encourage you to come see our production live and be a part of the conversation. We also have the original artwork (signed by the artists who created the pieces, cast and design teams) for this production and from our previous production up for sale. For more inquiry on that please contact us directly at outletensemblenyc@gmail.com!

If you are out of state and are unable to come to the show or donate, that's ok too! Part of our mission is to spread awareness about this campaign, this production and this company. That being said, it would be a major help if you could share, share, share this with others who also might be interested in donating, coming to the show or just spreading the love with sharing our message!

story:
Who we are

Middle Child is a not for profit theatre company, committed to making performances that reflect and promote the lives of Hull's residents.

Our annual panto is held at Fruit on Humber Street. The aim is to produce an affordable and alternative show for families in Hull to enjoy each year. Produced since 2012, we have always put local storylines, characters and references at the heart of the production. Tickets are affordable for families living in Hull and a fraction of the cost of other annual pantomimes that run at well-known theatres within the city.

In 2017, we will be working with nationally-acclaimed playwright Tom Wells - a Hull local himself - on a production of 'Cinderella'. The show will star a cast of seven local performers, with the local production company all based in the city. With 26 shows scheduled between the 16 and 30 December, we are expecting to welcome over 3,000 Hull family and friends through the panto doors this Christmas.

What we'll deliver

  • pay for the making and purchase of the set, props and costume needed
  • subsidise general admission ticket prices
  • 200 tickets to be given away to community groups in Hull most in need

Why it's a great idea

We want more families in Hull to have the opportunity to attend the theatre, as watching theatre can often be a defining moment that stays with you for the rest of your life. Our panto is an affordable alternative for any family wanting to take their child to see their first professional pantomime production.

For the past four years, we have also given away free tickets to William Booth House, an organisation providing services to the homeless throughout Hull. The offer has consistently been met with joy, at a time of year when many are most in need of some cheer. We would love to extend this offer to other organisations in 2017 - if you are interested please email mungo@middlechildtheatre.co.uk.

What you'll get in return

Rewards - Individual:

  • £5 - shout out on social media
  • £10 - above plus name in the programme and on our website
  • £50 - above plus signed copy of the poster
  • £150 - above plus five tickets to any performance
  • £250 - above plus a shout out of thanks at every show
  • £3,000 - above plus a private, bespoke performance of Cinderella, just for you!

 

And that's all there is to it! Help us spread the word and Christmas cheer this year. Thank you all so much, you wonderful people. 

Middle Child x

Rewards - Individual:

£5 - shout out on social media
£10 - above plus name in the programme and on our website
£50 - above plus signed copy of the poster
£150 - above plus five tickets to any performance
£250 - above plus a shout out of thanks at every show
£3,000 - above plus a private, bespoke performance of Cinderella, just for you!

 And that's all there is to it! Help us spread the word and Christmas cheer this year. Thank you all so much, you wonderful people. Middle Child x

story:
Short Summary

  • Rick Hamilton is an experienced theatre and film director who was the force behind off-Broadway hit, 'Fabulous - The Queen of Musical Comedies', 'Geeks!' and films such as Matchgirl and Seeing Glory.
  • Producing any theatre in the off off Broadway world is challenging because ticket prices have been historically low for a very long time and yet we theatre makers want to put on a first class show. We need help to be able to bring a production quality that this incredible show deserves.
  • This will be a unique production featuring a woman of color as Mama Rose, our cast is first rate and we are certain that your support will mean that an iconic show is performed and that a thrilled community will see top notch theatre in Queens.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are hoping to raise about $1000 - $3000 dollars. This money will go towards the great costumes as designed by Antonio Consuegra and will also be used to help us hire an incredible band. 
  • We have designed our perks to give you either tickets, merchandise that relate to our production of Gypsy.
  • We will receive whatever is raised due to flexible funding.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Gypsy is an important milestone in the development of modern musical theatre and we believe that our vision will give the audience a fresh exciting experience.
  • Our last two musicals both received multiple nominations from the New York Innovative Theatre Awards and the reviews were stellar.
  • We believe in this show, in you and in ourselves. Please help us be the best we can be.

Challenges

Whatever happens we are producing this show but we recognize that we may not raise all of the funds we need. 

  • This is a much loved show and we firmly believe that we will meet the goal.
  • We have an active and committed cast and crew.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this is not a good time and you are unable to contribute financially please consider sharing the link on your social media. This can make a huge difference

  • All posts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram will be helpful and could lead to other donations

story:
Αυτό το καλοκαίρι ανεβάζουμε τις «Τρεις Αδελφές» του Άντον Τσέχωφ και χρειαζόμαστε τη βοήθειά σας για να χρηματοδοτήσουμε την παραγωγή!

Μπορείτε να προσφέρετε όσο λίγο ή πολύ θέλετε. Έχουμε δημιουργήσει επίσης κάποια προνόμια για να σας ευχαριστήσουμε για τη βοήθειά σας, βρείτε τα στη δεξιά πλευρά της σελίδας.

ENGLISH

This summer, we're producing Anton Chekhov's "Three Sisters" and we need your help to fund its production!

Watch the video in English

Το Athens Acting Studio είναι ένα μέρος όπου καλλιτέχνες έρχονται μαζί, εργάζονται πάνω στη τέχνη τους και δημιουργούν νέα έργα. Είναι ένα μέρος όπου εργαζόμαστε για τη δημιουργία ανεξάρτητων καλλιτεχνών με νέες ιδέες. Αντιμετωπίζουμε όλους ως καλλιτέχνες από τη πρώτη ημέρα και θέλουμε όλοι πραγματικά να αισθάνονται έτσι. Δουλεύουμε ανοίγοντας το μυαλό και ξεκλειδώνοντας το σώμα.

The Athens Acting Studio is a place for people and artists to come together to work on their craft and develop new work. It’s a place where we work on creating individual artists with new ideas. We treat everyone as an artist from day one and we want people to feel that way. We work by opening the mind and unlocking the body.


ΓΙΑΤΙ ΤΟ ΚΑΝΟΥΜΕ;

Ο Νίκος Κατής ρώτησε: “Γιατί να το κανουμε τώρα;”. Είναι το κατάλληλο έργο για το σήμερα. Αντικατοπτρίζει το αδιέξοδο της κοινωνίας αυτή τη στιγμή στην Ελλάδα. Οι άνθρωποι θέλουν κάτι, αναζητούν την ταυτότητά τους, αλλά περιμένουν, είναι σε αδράνεια. Συνεχώς μιλάμε για το παρελθόν και το μέλλον, αλλά όχι για το σήμερα. Πού πάμε ως κοινωνία;

WHY WE DO (WHAT WE DO)

Nikos Katis, the Director, asked “Why do this now?”. It’s the right play for this moment in time, he says. It shows the stalemate of our society right now in Greece. People want something, question their identity but are waiting, in inactivity. We constantly talk about the past and the future but not about now. Where are we going as a society?

ΠΟΙΟΣ ΕΙΝΑΙ Ο ΣΤΟΧΟΣ ΜΑΣ;

Ποιος είναι ο στόχος του crowdfunding; Ο κόσμος να γνωρίσει και να ενωθεί με το όραμα του Athens Acting Studio και να συγκεντρωθούν τα χρήματα για την παραγωγή του έργου (στην Αθήνα και πιθανόν και σε άλλες πόλεις). 4000 ΕΥΡΩ 

WHAT IS OUR GOAL?

What is the crowdfunding goal? Get people interested and engaged with the Acting Studio and raise money to produce the show (in Athens and possibly in other cities). 4000 EUR


ΚΑΤΑΝΟΜΗ ΧΡΗΜΑΤΩΝ / ΕΠΙΤΕΥΞΗ ΔΙΑΦΑΝΕΙΑΣ

  • Θέατρο - Ενοίκιο 2500 ευρώ (κόστος της ενοικίασης του Θεάτρου για τις ημέρες των παραστάσεων και για τις πρόβες μας)
  • Σκηνικά / Φώτα 500 ευρώ (το κόστος εργασίας έχει δωριστεί, κόστος των υλικών και εξοπλισμού μόνο)
  • Κοστούμια 700 ευρώ (το κόστος εργασίας έχει δωριστεί, κόστος των υλικών μόνο)
  • Διαφήμιση και Προώθηση 250 ευρώ (οι δημιουργοί περιεχομένου δωρίζουν το χρόνο τους, κάλυψη κόστους εκτύπωσης αφισών, φυλλαδίων και διαφήμισης στο διαδίκτυο.
  • Οδοιπορικά 50 ευρώ (μίσθωση minibus, ενδιαφερόμαστε για το περιβάλλον, και εξοικονομούμε χρήματα) 

MONEY ALLOCATION / DELIVERING TRANSPARENCY

  • Theatre Rent 2500 EUR (Cost of renting the Theatre for the days of the performance and rehearsals)
  • Scenic Design / Lights 500 EUR (labour cost has been donated, cost of materials and equipment only)
  • Costumes 700 EUR (labour cost has been waived, cost of materials only)
  • Advertising and Promotion 250 EUR (content creators are donating their time, cost of printing posters,
  • flyers and online advertising only)
  • Travel Costs 50 EUR (minibus renting, we care about the environment, and it saves us money too)


ΤΙ ΜΠΟΡΟΥΜΕ ΝΑ ΣΑΣ ΠΡΟΣΦΕΡΟΥΜΕ

  1. Είμαστε στην ευχάριστη θέση να προσφέρουμε δωρεάν εισιτήρια για την παράστασή μας ως ευχαριστώ για την προσφορά σας.
  2. Ολόκληρη τη παράσταση διαθέσιμη για streaming στο YouTube.
  3. Συνομιλιες Skype και Google Hangouts με τον Νίκο Κατή και το cast, να μιλήσετε για το έργο και την τέχνη.
  4. Θα θέλαμε να καλέσουμε μερικούς ανθρώπους να στη σχολή στην Αθήνα, στην Ελλάδα για ένα βράδυ να μιλήσουμε για το θέατρο, τον Τσέχωφ και το στούντιο.
  5. Θέλουμε τα ονόματά σας να εκτυπωθούν στο πρόγραμμα μας και στις αίθουσες του Studio, για πάντα αναγνωρίζοντας την προσφορά σας
  6. Να σας προσφέρουμε την ευκαιρία να είστε παραγωγός μας.
  7. Να ενισχύσετε τους καλλιτέχνες να δημιουργήσουν, εδώ, στην Ελλάδα.


WHAT WE CAN GIVE YOU

  1. We are happy to offer free, complimentary tickets to our show
  2. the entire show available for streaming on YouTube
  3. Skype talks and Google Hangouts with Nikos Katis and the cast, to speak about the play and the art.
  4. We would like to invite a few people to join us at the school in Athens, Greece for an evening of talking about theatre, Chekhov and the school.
  5. Have donors names printed out on our programme and on the halls of the Acting Studio, forever recognizing their contribution.
  6. Have donors named “Producers”.
  7. Empower artists to create, here, in Greece.

Γιατί να συμβάλεις;

Οι καλλιτέχνες του studio θα νιώθουν ότι έχουν υποστήριξη. Είναι ένα καταπληκτικό συναίσθημα το να γνωρίζεις ότι πολλά άτομα έχουν συμβάλει και έχουν δείξει έμπρακτα την υποστήριξή τους για την τέχνη μας. Και με την τέχνη μας, δίνουμε πίσω στην κοινωνία. Όλοι μαζί μπορούμε να κάνουμε τη διαφορά.

Why should people contribute?

The studio’s artists will feel supported, it’s an amazing feeling knowing that many individuals have contributed and showed their support for our art. And with our art, we give back to society, we make a difference.


Χορηγοί Επικοινωνίας Communication Sponsors

Frapress.gr | Neolaia.gr | Books.gr | artnouveau.com.gr


_________________________________________


Έχετε ερωτήσεις; Βρείτε μας στο facebook.com/athensacting και ένας απο μας θα σας απαντήσει.


Got questions? Find us on facebook.com/athensacting and one of us will get back to you.

story:
Thank you so much for your support! Online we have inspired donations of $4250. Offline, we have another $250. What does that $4500 get us? Sound & Lighting! Meanwhile, the show must go on! We have had to rent risers and other equipment. We estimate the cost of permanent risers to be $8,000. Here's what our theater goers are saying about our first show Quantum Leap - Portals of Awakening Through Art & Dance in AUM New Ground Theater:

"During the whole performance of Quantum Leap, I really felt part of it, due to the closeness to the dancers and the cozy environment." 
"The whole performance is amazing! The last part of  Quantum Leap left me breathless and made me think."
"I loved the spoken part, the words went right to my heart. The Dancers were exceptional in expressing the meaning of the words through dance."
“Uplifting! Profound! Quantum Leap gives you the courage to break out of your materialistic unsatisfactory life to become whole and embrace the spiritual/creative side."     

AUM President and NewGround Theatre Dance Company Artistic Director, Coleen Lorenz, trying out stage lighting. We're making do for now, but still need your help! 

Help us finish this campaign on a high note! Your donations help us bring uplifting messages to our community in an intimate theater setting without dipping into funds earmarked for community outreach. 

NewGround Theatre Dance Company performing first show in new theater, Quantum Leap - Portals of Awakening Through Art & Dance. 

Out of the Great Mystery

The numinous waves of intelligent force

We become

Sparks of moving Light

Dynamic energy

Quantum flow shaped into particle form

Life that is aware of itself as life

We exist as one majestic hologram

A giant interconnected web of experience

Where each and every part contains a blueprint of the whole

Science now speaks the language of Spirit . . .

There is no separation

Be A Part of the Movement!

Arts Unity Movement and the people behind it believe in the call to create a more compassionate world through authentic expression and the arts. In this technological age, people are more innovative and creative than ever before. However, stress is also on the rise and we are now facing the challenge of finding better ways of living to off-set our fast paced world. 

AUM's hope is to activate the power of the human heart and calm the mind, thereby balancing the whole person, catalyzing kindness and compassion for ourselves and others. Our group of practitioners, therapists and artists have been a part of this mission for over a decade. We are grateful and humbled by the momentum and support we have been receiving recently, and are excited to be riding the wave of positive change that is growing in our world today!


WHO WE ARE: 

Arts Unity Movement (AUM) Non-Profit has been dedicated to effective approaches in healing, self-expression, mindfulness, and stress reduction since 1988. AUM evolved as a group of board certified/licensed holistic practitioners, expressive arts therapists, and life coaches invested in offering wellness through the arts to the broader community. 


WHAT WE DO:
AUM is home to the NewGround Theatre Dance Company which has presented storyline performances to thousands of people since 2008. AUM has also offered hundreds of classes in mindfulness practices, art, dance, and music to the community, and has facilitated drum circles for youth through the San Mateo County Behavioral Health Department. All classes are offered on a sliding scale with no one turned away for lack of funds. Reiki/Healing Touch is offered at a discounted rate on Reiki/Healing Touch Nights so all can afford stress relief. 

AUM promotes unity through Empathic Resonance – a transferring of emotional energy in artistic expression that moves both performer and observer into a direct heart exchange - sharing a common thread of human experience through the highs and lows of our life stories

AUM's NewGround Theatre Dance Company has offered story-based productions including Earth Dance, Terrain Project, Axiom, Catalyst, Into The Unseen, Breaking New Ground, and Transformations (see gallery for videos and pics)  AUM was awarded a grant from San Mateo County Arts Commission for NewGround Company’s past performances entitled Into the Unseen and Transformations (2014). Each dance production has carried a message of hope for humanity and global change. 

AUM’s activities and performances also promote unity and equality and a sharing of the human heart connection. There has been an overwhelmingly positive response from the community for NewGround productions and activities at the AUM Center.


Artist's Response Night for the Upcoming Show, Quantum Leap - Portals of Awakening through Art and Dance, beginning June 5th.


Experience The Power of Empathic Resonance at AUM New Ground Theater

OUR PURPOSE:

AUM's goal is to share its message of equality and unity with more of the community through its fusion dance and art performances, along with a variety of unique, interactive experiences for all ages, such as Open Mic - Expressions From the Heart, HeartMoves Dance Gatherings, Movie Night, and other events. 

Human Connection Through Art, Music, Poetry, Media, Storytelling, and Dance

By contributing to our campaign, you become part of the AUM experience.  AUM hosts heart-centered activities that facilitate empathy, awareness, and connection to discover positive regard and appreciation for ourselves and others. 


Any funds over the stretch goal go to the NewGround Theatre Dance Company and the touring of their production, Quantum Leap. 

If you are also feeling the call to strengthen the fabric of society by building the human heart connection, please join us by donating to our theater fund! 

Help Us Spread the Word!

Please share this campaign with others through email and social media. Together we can make a difference!

Arts Unity Movement and the people behind it believe in the call to create a more compassionate world through authentic expression and the arts. In this technological age, people are more innovative and creative than ever before. However, stress is also on the rise and we are now facing the challenge of finding better ways of living to off-set our fast paced world. 
AUM's hope is to activate the power of the human heart and calm the mind, thereby balancing the whole person, catalyzing kindness and compassion for ourselves and others. Our group of practitioners, therapists and artists have been a part of this mission for over a decade. We are grateful and humbled by the momentum and support we have been receiving recently, and are excited to be riding the wave of positive change that is growing in our world today!


WHO WE ARE: 
Arts Unity Movement (AUM) Non-Profit has been dedicated to effective approaches in healing, self-expression, mindfulness, and stress reduction since 1988. AUM evolved as a group of board certified/licensed holistic practitioners, expressive arts therapists, and life coaches invested in offering wellness through the arts to the broader community. 
WHAT WE DO:
AUM is home to the NewGround Theatre Dance Company which has presented storyline performances to thousands of people since 2008. AUM has also offered hundreds of classes in mindfulness
practices, art, dance, and music to the community, and has facilitated drum
circles for youth through the San Mateo County Behavioral Health Department. All classes are offered on a sliding scale with no one turned away for lack of funds. Reiki/Healing Touch is offered at a discounted rate on Reiki/Healing Touch Nights so all can afford stress relief. 

AUM promotes unity through
Empathic Resonance – a transferring of emotional energy in artistic expression that
moves both performer and observer into a direct heart exchange - sharing a common thread of human experience through the highs and lows of our life stories
AUM's NewGround Theatre Dance Company has offered story-based productions including Earth Dance, Terrain Project, Axiom, Catalyst, Into The
Unseen, Breaking New Ground, and Transformations (see gallery for videos and pics)  AUM was awarded a grant from San Mateo County Arts Commission for NewGround Company’s past performances entitled Into the Unseen and Transformations (2014). Each
dance production has carried a message of hope for humanity and global change. AUM’s activities and performances also promote unity and equality and a sharing of the human heart connection. There has
been an overwhelmingly positive response from the community for NewGround productions and activities at the AUM Center.


Artist's Response Night for the Upcoming Show, Quantum Leap - Portals of Awakening through Art and Dance, beginning June 5th.
Experience The Power of Empathic Resonance at AUM New Ground Theater
OUR PURPOSE:
AUM's goal is to share its message of equality and unity with more of the community through its fusion dance and art performances, along with a variety of unique, interactive experiences for all ages, such as Open Mic - Expressions From the Heart, HeartMoves Dance Gatherings, Movie Night, and other events. 
Human Connection Through Art, Music, Poetry, Media, Storytelling, and Dance
By contributing to our campaign, you become part of the AUM experience.  AUM hosts heart-centered activities that facilitate empathy, awareness, and connection to discover positive regard and appreciation for ourselves and others. 




Any funds over the stretch goal go to the NewGround Theatre Dance Company and the touring of their production, Quantum Leap. 
If you are also feeling the call to strengthen the fabric of society by building the human heart connection, please join us by donating to our theater fund! 
    Help Us Spread the Word! Please share this campaign with others through email and social media. Together we can make a difference!

story:
Wendy's Shadow:

The mischievous and magical adventure of Peter Pan is retold from Wendy’s modern-day perspective with a contemporary folk/rock score. With Music and Lyrics by David Maglione and Tomas Ruiz and Book by Jason Cannon, Wendy's Shadow takes the audience back to the Neverland — where dreams are born, and time is never planned — and asks if it’s ever possible to leave the one you loved.

History:

We (Dave and Tomas) began writing songs for a potential Peter Pan musical in 2013. In the summer of 2014, we approached Jason Cannon to write the book. By that November, we presented the first draft of the show at the Irvington Town Hall Theatre, as part of their new works series. Following the reading, we worked a second draft of the score, orchestrated it for a 7 piece band and presented a concert reading at The Cutting Room in NYC. More edits and reworks took place for an 11 track concept album that was recorded at Water Music Recorders, in April of 2015. 
Now:
We are back in development for the fourth time, preparing the book/score for a Writers Lab in June of 2015. In July,we have been invited to present at NYMF as part of their Concert Series. 

The Lab:

The Writers Lab gives us the chance to put the show on its for the first time, while incorporating new re-writes. Over the course of 3 weeks, a music director will teach the score and a director/choreographer will stage it. By the end of the Lab, we will have a final draft of Wendy's Shadow. In order to accomplish this, we need: 

  • Rehearsal Space
  • A Director/Choreographer
  • A Music Director
  • 2 Stage Managers
  • 12 Actors
  • 1 Production Asst. 
  • Rehearsal Material/Printing
  • Musicians
NYMF:
We are really looking forward to presenting Wendy's Shadow this summer at NYMF. In order to do that we need a few things: 
  • Participation Fee
  • Rehearsal Space
  • 7 Musicians
  • Sound equipment 

Where You Come In:

This summer is going to be very exciting for us, as well as for the show. There is nothing easy about mounting a new work, but your help allows us to take huge step forward with the piece. Check out the perks to see how you can be involved.  
Thank you so much for supporting us and for supporting new works. This project is very special to us and we can't to share it with you!

story:
THEATRE ON THE WATER






THE PROJECT

1st Challenge: Think of an Opera performance considered the archetype of the musical theatre but little known, to be made into a unique and unforgettable experience on the liquid stage of the Theatre by the water.

2nd Challenge: to invite musicians, opera singers, actors, background actors to perform on the water of Arona's old port dressed with a bald and essential scenic design.

3rd Challenge: to get local people and tourists involved. Thanks to their skills and simple enthusiasm they can be of great help to the experts to create the perfect show.





To support our challenges we choose the Battle between Tancredi and Clorinda, Claudio Monteverdi's madrigal on Torquato Tasso's works, a real milestone of XVII century's dramatic music, experimental and highly innovative at that time. The text is also revolutionary and extremely up-to-date: Clorinda and Tancredi perfectly represent the eternal struggle between human passions (ideological, religious, human). The production we planned is something unique: Lake Maggiore becomes a natural stage for actors and musicians where even the boats seem to be dancing.




                                                    WHO WE ARE

Theatre on the water  was created in order to enjoy theatre performances in a place where an actual stage had never existed. Moved by affection and respect, Dacia Maraini, our creative director and a well renown Italian writer, poetess, essayist, playwright and scriptwriter, offered to bring her talent to the lake to create a festival dedicated to  theatre performances and encounters with writers where any corner within the city of Arona and the lake itself turn into a stage.

"We believe that culture is essential to the wellness of a country, because it teaches to think and to understand what is different respecting every identity.

We believe that an International Festival dedicated to theatre and words can be a school for both children and adults, a place to meet new people and to discover new things and to learn how to enter the future light hearted and self-confident..."

Dacia Maraini



       

                                                            OUR REQUEST

Become a co-producer of this unique experience!

The total or partial achievement of our financial goal will allow us to make a wonderful show possible facing the numerous artistic and technical necessities.

WE NEED YOU, HELP US TO MAKE IT REAL!!!





 TEATRO SULL'ACQUA




IL PROGETTO

SFIDA 1: prendere un’opera, considerata l’archetipo del teatro musicale ma poco conosciuta, e renderla unica e indimenticabile sul palco liquido del Teatro sull’Acqua.


SFIDA 2: portare musicisti, cantanti d’opera, attori, comparse e un’essenziale ma complessa scenografia sull’acqua del Vecchio Porto di Arona.

SFIDA 3: coinvolgere nel lavoro abitanti e turisti, che,  per le loro competenze o per il solo entusiasmo, saranno spalle fondamentali dei professionisti nella creazione dello spettacolo. Creare così, di fatto, un’opera della città.


Il Teatro sull' ™Acqua nasce dal desiderio di portare il teatro in un territorio dove non esiste un teatro.

Per affetto e stima, Dacia Maraini, scrittrice, poetessa, saggista, drammaturga e sceneggiatrice italiana, e nostra direttrice artistica, ha deciso di portare il suo talento sul nostro lago per realizzare un festival di teatro e parola, dove ogni luogo diventa palcoscenico, la strada, i ristoranti, le ville, i cortili, le vetrine e lo specchio del lago Maggiore.

"Noi crediamo che la cultura sia necessaria al benessere di un paese, perchè la cultura insegna a pensare e a capire, insegna ad unire le diversità  nel rispetto della più distante identità . E crediamo che un festival internazionale di teatro e parola, che diventi scuola per i bambini e per adulti consapevoli, sia un luogo di incontri, di conoscenza, di approfondimento, di creazione, un luogo in cui imparare ad entrare nel futuro col piede leggero e sicuro..."

Dacia Maraini



CHI SIAMO


Il Teatro sull’Acqua nasce dal desiderio di portare il teatro in un territorio dove non esiste un teatro.
Per affetto e stima, Dacia Maraini, scrittrice, poetessa, saggista, drammaturga e sceneggiatrice italiana, e nostra direttrice artistica, ha deciso di portare il suo talento sul nostro lago per realizzare un festival di teatro e parola, dove ogni luogo diventa palcoscenico, la strada, i ristoranti, le ville, i cortili, le vetrine e lo specchio del lago Maggiore.

"Noi crediamo che la cultura sia necessaria al benessere di un paese, perché la cultura insegna a pensare e a capire, insegna ad unire le diversità nel rispetto della più distante identità. E crediamo che un festival internazionale di teatro e parola, che diventi scuola per i bambini e per adulti consapevoli, sia un luogo di incontri, di conoscenza, di approfondimento, di creazione, un luogo in cui imparare ad entrare nel futuro col piede leggero e sicuro..."

Dacia Maraini


COSA CHIEDIAMO

Diventa co-produttore di quest’opera unica!

Il raggiungimento totale o parziale della raccolta fondi ci permetterà di realizzare lo spettacolo rispondendo alle varie necessità tecniche e artistiche:

palchi galleggianti, barche, rematori, sommozzatori, servizio di sicurezza sull’acqua, musicisti, tenori, soprani, attori, regista, direttore luci, direttore di produzione, ingegnere del suono, quinte sceniche, recinzioni, platea, sartoria, attrezzeria.







PER L'ALLESTIMENTO DEL TEATRO SULL’ACQUA AVREMO BISOGNO DEL TUO AIUTO

story:
Hello,

My name is Diane Torr and I am an international artist and performer.  I'm bringing my performance, DONALD DOES DUSTY to Summerhall at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival  for the last two weeks of August. 

We (my team and i) are trying to raise £5000  (We tried the Greek example but with an austerity programme we just lost weight) to cover the basic costs of having a show at the Fringe. (I mean there's just so many meals of beans and toast you can take).  Costs include: theatre rental (we're maxing out our credit cards on that one), accommodation (we smugly snared a student flat for the first week and need to find the $$ for the second week - hey - you could help!) insurance, hiring equipment, hiring technical staff, publicity person (yeah - I bet you think that's an unnecessary expense, but I can tell you this is EDINBURGH - the competition - the competition - ad infinitum) , producer, flyers/programmes - design and print (no - not photocopies - that's not going to impress anyone), and paying to use the wonderfully upbeat Dusty Springfield songs (essential love expense) that are included in the performance. YOU can be part of tis project and save our asses and get bums on seats (not the same ones).  Check out the perks.  There for you. Begin by simply opening your wallet and continue….and see your name in print as a sponsor. Be a part of DONALD DOES DUSTY.  Feel the love.

DONALD DOES DUSTY is a finely honed performance, originally created with seed funding from the Scottish Arts Council (as it was then called) and commissioned by the Glasgay Festival.  I have performed various versions through the past nine years.  Now - and with the assistance of the inspiring New York director, Lizzie Olesker - DONALD DOES DUSTY is complete.  I tested it out at the HOT! Festival, Dixon Place, Manhattan last year, and received a glowing response from the sold-out crowd. "A moving performance"; "Transformative"; "A passionate tribute to your brother and to Dusty" were some of the audience quotes.  I'm really pleased to have the opportunity to show my work at the Fringe and it would be fantastic if you could help me get DONALD DOES DUSTY to this international showcase.

Here's a bit more about the show itself.

In it, I play four roles: myself; Donald; Donald as Dusty; Dusty Springfield

We were kids growing up in Aberdeen in the 60s and my older brother, Donald, was fascinated with Dusty Springfield.  With a boy scout eagle-eyed attention, he took in her every gesture and shift of gaze when she sang on the TV programmme, Ready Steady Go!  Whenever my parents were out, Donald quickly changed into my mother's long evening dress, evening gloves, diamante earrings and high-heels.  I was recruited (reluctantly) to sit by the long mirror and award him points for how well he could "do Dusty".  Donald swanned across the carpet watching himself in the mirror as he sang "Wishin' and Hopin' over and over again, trying hard to reproduce what he'd seen on TV.   He was never satisfied.  I was bored.  Donald knew he was gay and Dusty was the only other gay person he was aware of.  It was Dusty and Donald on one side and the rest of Aberdeen on the other. 

During the early 70's Donald was a singer and dancer in the television troupe, The Young Generation - they were a vibrant, fun-loving bunch of dancers, without a hint of cynicism. I was fortunate to access some footage from the BBC, of a  show in which Dusty and The Young Generation both perform. Watch the video for a wee glimpse.

The Red Lecture Theatre, Summerhall, Fringe Venue 26 from August 17-30(not August 25) at 7.35pm Ticket prices: £12/8 Box Office: 0131 560 1580 http://www.summerhall.co.uk

I’m grateful to have already received some preview press.  Here’s one from DIVA Magazine: “60seconds with Diane Torr”diva interview

and another piece by the Scottish journalist Andrew EatonLewis in a longer article about gender.  Seems to be a theme in the Fringe this year….finally!                                      http://bellacaledonia.org.uk/2015/07/17/the-age-of-gendersaurus/

story:
Our Vision For YOU

Bring fresh dance from New York City to San Francisco. Be a part of UNA's first tour!

UNA

NYC based Dance Company UNA Projects was created by Artistic Director and Founder, Chuck Wilt in 2013. A native of San Francisco, Chuck is a graduate of NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. See bio for more details. 

UNA Projects evolves through the creative process. Drawing inspiration from film, humor, love and a wide range of physicality in movement, UNA makes dance relevant. The company’s work is bold, physical and emotionally layered - bringing the audience into exciting ways of thinking and viewing dance. 

Itinerary

October 1st 7:30PM: Rodeo
Choreography by Chuck Wilt, Molly Rogers and Bobbi Jene Smith. Performed by UNA Projects and guest performers Meredith Webster, Courtney Mazeika and Marlie Couto.


October 2nd 7:30PM: Ships and Salsa
Choreographed by Chuck Wilt. Performed by UNA Projects. 
Talkback with Chuck Wilt, moderated by Marie Tollen


October 3rd 7:30PM: Ships and Salsa
Choreographed by Chuck Wilt. Performed by UNA Projects. 
Reception with the artists



It is an impactful time for UNA to maximize our exposure and to create more opportunities sharing dance. Our first tour across the country is HUGE and we won't be able to accomplish it without YOUR support.



To Break IT Down

$6,000 is the biggest and most important of them all: it provides the dancers, who are more than worth it (dancer fees)

$2,100 feeds the company while on tour (per diem)

$1,500 gives us beautiful lights to dance in (lighting design)

$350 gives us the means to get around town (bus/subway)



The REPertory

Ships

Ships is a study on being alone and uses themes of the sea.

+

Salsa

A 35-minute piece, Salsa takes the audience on a journey through stories of fantasy and reality using rhythm and groove as movement motivators and storytellers.

+

Rodeo

A world premiere and collaborative evening, Rodeo is a playful expression of the self: dressing up and removing layers.



The ARTISTS

Artistic Director and Choreographer: Chuck Wilt

Guest Choreographers: Molly Rogers, Bobbi Jene Smith

UNA's Performers: Kyle Filley, Catherine Ellis Kirk, Lauren Kravitz, Jayne Paley and Chuck Wilt

Guest Performers: Marlie Couto, Courtney Mazeika (Alex Ketley's The Foundry) and Meredith Webster (Former Alonzo King's Lines Ballet member)

Photographers: Nir Arieli and Lindsey Smith

Cinematographers: Jake Saner and Paul Galando

More about the Artists.
story_txt:
Our Vision For YOU
Bring fresh dance from New York City to San Francisco. Be a part of UNA's first tour!
UNA
NYC based Dance Company UNA Projects was created by Artistic Director and Founder, Chuck Wilt in 2013. A native of San Francisco, Chuck is a graduate of NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. See bio for more details. 
UNA Projects evolves through the creative process. Drawing inspiration from film, humor, love and a wide range of physicality in movement, UNA makes dance relevant. The company’s work is bold, physical and emotionally layered - bringing the audience into exciting ways of thinking and viewing dance. 
Itinerary
October 1st 7:30PM: RodeoChoreography by Chuck Wilt, Molly Rogers and Bobbi Jene Smith. Performed by UNA Projects and guest performers Meredith Webster, Courtney Mazeika and Marlie Couto.October 2nd 7:30PM: Ships and SalsaChoreographed by Chuck Wilt. Performed by UNA Projects. Talkback with Chuck Wilt, moderated by Marie TollenOctober 3rd 7:30PM: Ships and SalsaChoreographed by Chuck Wilt. Performed by UNA Projects. Reception with the artists



It is an impactful time for UNA to maximize our exposure and to create more opportunities sharing dance. Our first tour across the country is HUGE and we won't be able to accomplish it without YOUR support.




To Break IT Down
$6,000 is the biggest and most important of them all: it provides the dancers, who are more than worth it (dancer fees)
$2,100 feeds the company while on tour (per diem)
$1,500 gives us beautiful lights to dance in (lighting design)
$350 gives us the means to get around town (bus/subway)


The REPertory
Ships
Ships is a study on being alone and uses themes of the sea.
+
Salsa
A 35-minute piece, Salsa takes the audience on a journey through stories of fantasy and reality using rhythm and groove as movement motivators and storytellers.
+
Rodeo
A world premiere and collaborative evening, Rodeo is a playful expression of the self: dressing up and removing layers.





The ARTISTS
Artistic Director and Choreographer: Chuck Wilt
Guest Choreographers: Molly Rogers, Bobbi Jene Smith
UNA's Performers: Kyle Filley, Catherine Ellis Kirk, Lauren Kravitz, Jayne Paley and Chuck Wilt
Guest Performers: Marlie Couto, Courtney Mazeika (Alex Ketley's The Foundry) and Meredith Webster (Former Alonzo King's Lines Ballet member)
Photographers: Nir Arieli and Lindsey Smith
Cinematographers: Jake Saner and Paul Galando
More about the Artists.

story:
What is The Tooth of Crime?

The Tooth Of Crime is Sam Shepard's assault course on American Pop Culture. It is chock full of violently clashing vocal styles, noise, spectacle, silliness, shock, and brutality- all set to live music. The Tooth of Crime is also Maridee Slater's (That's me!) thesis production for her MFA in Directing at Columbia University. It's ALSO a showcase of some of the most incredible and diverse ensemble of designers, musicians, performers of all flavors. 

This production began as a suggestion from Anne Bogart. Over the past few months, it has become so much more:

A representation of personal recollections and past trials.

A love song to collaboration.

An ode to rock music.

An embrace with change. 

One hell of a ride.

And we need your help to light this fire. 

March 11th-14th at The Connelly Theatre, 220 E 4th Ave, NYC, NY 11213


The Team

Written by Sam Shepard

Directed by Maridee Slater
Assistant Director- Sam Plattus
Original Music Composed by Sam Gelband and Jillie Mae Eddy
Arrangements and Musical Direction by Ethan Forrest Wagner

Production Stage Manager- Krystle Henninger
Assistant Stage Manager- Jessi Cotter
Assistant Stage Manager- Blake Kile
Scenic Designer- Scott Mancha
Lighting/Video Designer- David Bengali
Costume Designer- Joey Blaha

Sound Designer- Ryan Hopper

Produced by Lindsay Alexis
General Manager- Yue Liu

Marketing and Fundraising in collaboration with Lickety Split

Featuring the incomparable talent of: Marianne Ciasulli, Xandra Clark, Tre D’Ambrocia, Jessica Davis, Jillie Mae Eddy, Ryan Hopper, Ariel Lauren, Libby Matthews, Javan Nelson, Ryan Nicholls, and Valerie Redd.


The Charts

We've got a lot to accomplish. And we aim high. Something Durable. Something Lasting. This is an incredible team, and we're going fast and furious.  It takes a lot to make a True Marksman. A worthwhile work. The Tooth of Crime believes in paying our gang for their hard time. In the words of our sound designer and guitarist Ryan Hopper, "I love this show! I'm so glad to be a part of cool theatre." We all are. Scrappy and scrapin' it together, we're gathering artillery to support this vanguard. 

Thanks to Columbia Stages, we have some of the support needed. We really want to give the incredible talent we have working on this show everything they need to achieve their dreams, and so we're coming to you. We want to give our designers the materials they need, and our band, MONOCHROME FILTER, the power they need to blow the roof off of The Connelly. We also want to pay this team a stipend worthy of their blood, sweat, tears, and passion for this project.

Things we need to purchase: Instrument and mic cables, proper amplification, pick-ups, mic and instrument stands, prop rental, costumes, and strings for instruments are just a few of the materials we are in need of. 

In our wildest dreams, we raise enough money to record an EP. 


Risks & Challenges

As much as we zoot down and straighten our ears, there's still a risk of unsettle. It's an ambitious undertaking making a play of this magnitude. Our incredible band, MONOCHROME FILTER, needs a lot of juice to fly right. This ain't no acoustic honky tonk. We're in it for LIGHTNING. We are tapping into a whole new line of spark. 


The Air is Your Genius

Can't afford to contribute to the charts with dough? There are other ways of joining our Gang. Spread the word on social media, on the sidewalk, in the bathroom at the bar, on the subway, in the trenches, at work, or your next concert.

story:
In its inaugural New York season, Monica Hogan Danceworks (MHDW) performed at 11 diverse venues and conducted multiple master classes across the country. Monica’s choreography has been well-received in New York with critics emphasizing that they would “love to see more of this work” (Oberon's Grove).  

Monica Hogan Danceworks has a number of performances planned for the 2015 Spring Season. Most recently, MHDW was selected by the Moving Beauty Series to present 45 minutes of original work on a split bill in early March. 

The selection of works being presented in The Series represent an excellent cross-section of the diverse repertoire of Monica Hogan Danceworks, highlighting the company’s refined sense of movement detail. Each of these pieces explores, honors, and celebrates the complexity and intimacy of human relationships in a unique way.

The performance will be the company’s largest New York premiere to date and will feature seasoned Company dancers alongside a number of new Apprentices. MHDW is thrilled for this opportunity to present these new works featuring a full ensemble. 

With this growth comes increased responsibility to our performing artists and the greater dance community. It is important at MHDW that we compensate the tremendous efforts of these exceptionally talented artists. 

_____________________________________________

Here is where you come in -- fans, family, friends, dancers, and dance-lovers alike! Please consider making a donation to help us create and present our best season yet. Every donation, no matter the size, gets us one step closer to bringing new works to the stage!

Projected Budget: $3,500

Space Rental:  $1000 

Dancer Compensation: $1200 

Costumes, Props, Set Pieces: $550

Promotional Materials: $450 

Rehearsal Director Fee: $300

And if we surpass our goal? Any and all extra money raised will go directly to our deserving artists, supplementing their already budgeted performance stipends.

_____________________________________________

PC: Eric Bandiero

Featured Artists

Dancers: Chloé Cheney-Rice, Eimile Davis, Gretchen Hoffman, Christen Quattlebaum, Jillian Egan, Evelyn Fontana, Louisa Pancoast, Ellen Sickenberger, Xavier Townsend, Allison Wardwell

Choreography: Monica Hogan

Company Manager/Rehearsal Assistant: Courtney Liu

Contributing Guest Choreographer: Emily Hogan

_____________________________________________

PC: Paula Lobo

A Snapshot of 2014

We know how to pack a whole lot of dance into just one calendar year! Check out all the places we performed and offered programming in 2014:

  • DUMBO Dance Festival - John Ryan Theater
  • BalaSole Dance Co's "Mélange" - Ailey Citigroup Theater
  • NYC10 Dance Initiative - Dixon Place
  • DEMAN (Duke Entertainment, Media, and Arts Network) Dance Masterclass - Duke University
  • NY Jazz Choreography Project - Salvatore Capezio Theatre
  • CoolNY Dance Festival - John Ryan Theater
  • NACHMO (Natl. Choreography Month) Gala - Actors Fund Arts Center
  • Backstage Series: MHDW Contemporary Masterclass - Duke University
  • Brooklyn Free Clinic Conference - Brooklyn Lyceum
  • Fertile Ground - Green Space
  • MaD Circle Dance Concert - Jan Hus Church
  • 3rd Space - Queens Council on the Arts

Your support will help us keep building this momentum and developing new work. Help us make 2015 even better!

_____________________________________________

PC: Peter Yesley

Monica Hogan Danceworks is a distinctive contemporary dance company based in NYC. Their repertoire reimagines archetypal relationships through explorative composition with a unique stylistic virtuosity that blends Monica’s backgrounds in modern, contemporary, ballet, jazz, and theater. The company is known for performing with a clarity of vision and musicality that communicates through athletic and intentional movement. Monica Hogan Danceworks cultivates collaboration by integrating dance performance with alternative digital and artistic media. The company aims to unite dance artists of diverse backgrounds, allowing their unique experiences to contribute to the creative process and commit the distinctiveness of their own artistic voices to the movement.

_____________________________________________

PC: Alec Himwich

Monica Hogan (Artistic Director) is a professional choreographer, teacher, and dancer based in New York City. As the artistic director of her company, she has presented choreography on stages internationally including: Ailey Citigroup Theater, DUMBO Dance Festival, Dixon Place, Actor’s Fund Arts Center, NY Jazz Choreography Project, Queens Council on the Arts, CoolNY Dance Festival (NYC); Xuzhou Concert Hall, Tianjin Concert Hall (China); Triangle Dance Festival for AIDS (NC); and Jazz on Tap (GA), to name a few. Monica teaches advanced/intermediate contemporary and jazz classes throughout the New York area, including Peridance Capezio Center. She and her company have held numerous artist-in-residence masterclasses and discussion panels for the Duke University Dance Program.

Monica has performed professionally with companies including Gaspard&Dancers, De Funes Dance Company, BalaSole Dance Company, Phyzix Urban Dance Theatre, and more. On screen, Monica has performed in music videos for artists including Delta Rae and Vienna Teng and in work for AdCouncil and The College Board. In 2011, she was a choreographer and dancer in the opening ceremonies of the Universiade olympic games in Shenzhen, China. She serves the greater dance community as Marketing Director for National Choreography Month (NACHMO).

She was born and raised in Atlanta, Georgia, where she trained at numerous studios including the Georgia Ballet and Atlanta Ballet. Monica graduated with distinction in Dance Choreography and Performance from Duke University, where she was the winner of the Louis Sudler Prize in the Creative and Performing Arts. While there, Monica had the opportunity to learn from workshops with artists/companies including Alonzo King’s LINES, Nederlands Dans Theater, Alvin Ailey, Chunky Move, Mark Dendy, David Dorfman, Donald Byrd, Shen Wei, Cedar Lake Contemporary Ballet, and more. Her performance repertory there included Twyla Tharp's Eight Jelly Rolls and Torelli, along with countless works by acclaimed dance faculty. Monica's choreography has appeared on national and international stages, and she has directed three of her own annual productions of Heartwork, a series integrating dance with alternative digital media.

story:
Do The Math is a world premiere production of selections from Emily Galvin's book of poetry and poetic dialogues.  An ensemble of three actors creates a sequence of six hyper-realistic vignettes.  This dark comedy explores themes of love, loss, and isolation using algorithms to expose patterns in behavior.  The evocative language mixed with the elegant purity of the mathematical architecture allows for a rhythmic and organic unfolding in time.

This is the Overcast Theatre's first production of 2015 and we need your support to realize it!

This is a flash fundraiser, meaning a short fundraiser to see how much money we can raise as we go into production mode and raise awareness of our project. We have a limited amount of time and our relishing the challenge. $1600 is only part of the journey to make this show happen but with limited time we were looking at a realistic goal.

The production opens March 12 and plays for two weekends through March 22nd at the Phoenix Theatre in San Francisco. 

More Information at: https://www.facebook.com/events/784994264887894

Overcast Theatre was founded in September 2012 and does not specialize in a certain type of theatre but instead wishes to cover as much of the range and spectrum as possible. We strive for interdisciplinary and diverse looks into performance and art. We are excited to mount less known works and execute new and experimental pieces and also invite fresh takes on classics and more popular theatre.

Most importantly our goal is to make theatre accessible or at least an instance where an individual was exposed to something different whether they are theatrical experts or seeing their very first show. 

YOUR IMPACT

Producing theatre isn't as easy or as inexpensive as you might think. Your contributions would be used to assist us with the costs of facility rentals, cast/crew stipends, and design aspects for the production. In essence you are contributing to the art making process! Think of yourself as a modern day patron of the arts.

Some incentives to contributing to our project outside our undying gratitude include some fun stuff like: tickets to the show, signed stash, and some memorabilia!

Even if we do not reach our goal, all our collected funds will be going to the same place... to making this show happen!

What makes this show special?

Overcast Theatre strives to make interesting, accessible, and affordable theatre. We are excited to make old and new theatre as long as it'll capture your eye. 

This show examines themes of isolation in tragic and comedic ways, a theme many can relate to especially in the ever growing city of San Francisco or anywhere else really. The show takes one on a journey through the plains of Iowa, border towns of Nevada and Utah, rants on peanut butter, human fixations, and a relationship that's lasted forever. Finally we will be taking on multimedia to create an interdisciplinary production also featuring productions and alternative lighting. 

Though Overcast is young, it is not new. Since 2012 we have produced and mounted 5 full scale productions and 1 series of staged readings of new works! We look forward to many more as Do That Math marks our seventh installment.

How else can I help?

Not able to send a donation? No problem! Tell your friends! Tell your rich uncle! Share a link on social media! Most Importantly, come see the show opening March 12th!
